Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
¡Bienvenido al lugar que te mereces!




🔍¿Qué buscamos?




Buscamos un/una Machine Learning que aporte al menos dos años de experiencia para trabajar en la unidad de AIF Engineering, para la adecuación de modelos analíticos al entorno bancario en todas aquellas labores de integración necesarias, desde la participación en el diseño, desarrollo, integración, monitorización, rendimiento y modificaciones.




Te buscamos, independientemente de tu género, capacidades diferentes, orientación sexual, origen étnico o cualquier característica que te haga único/a.




✨Qué esperamos de ti✨




Formación y experiencia

Titulación en informática, telecomunicaciones, ingeniería
Conocimientos de arquitectura de aplicaciones y computación distribuida
Conocimientos sobre analítica de datos y machine learning
Lenguajes (experiencia mínima en alguno de ellos de 2 años): Python, Scala, Spark
Conocimientos de desarrollo y gestión de microservicios
Deseable certificación en cloud pública y en Devops
Conocimientos de SQL




Competencias

Alta capacidad para aprender nuevas tecnologías referentes a plataforma, nube, arquitectura y seguridad
Capacidad de trabajar en entornos de cambio e innovación y flexibilidad y adaptabilidad a las necesidades de los proyectos
Proactividad en la propuesta de soluciones y colaboraciones
Capacidad de análisis y abstracción
Capacidad de comunicación, responsabilidad, compromiso, compañerismo y trabajo en
equipo.




😎 Qué responsabilidades tendrás:




En la fase de desarrollo del dato:

Aplicación de las mejores prácticas de ingeniería del software a los proyectos realizados
Reimplementación / Reestructuración de código de motores analíticos en caso necesario.
Participar en el ciclo de vida del producto junto con otros roles (Data Scientist, Data Hub, Arquitectos)
Realizar las pruebas pertinentes generando métricas de calidad medibles
Integrando los productos desarrollados dentro del ecosistema bancario
Compartiendo conocimiento con sus compañeros de equipo y de unidad para mejorar las sinergias
Generando la documentación técnica necesaria para la correcta ejecución del proyecto




Finalmente, durante la fase de implantación:

Validar los niveles de calidad generados en el desarrollo en curso
Desplegar los desarrollos en los diferentes entornos corporativos
Monitorizar el comportamiento técnico de los mismos
Operar los desarrollos aplicativos en los entornos corporativos
Realizar un mantenimiento evolutivo y correctivo de los desarrollos realizados




💙Qué tenemos de especial




2000€ anuales para seguir formándote dentro de tu horario laboral y alimentar esa curiosidad infinita que tanto nos gusta!! Tenemos un modelo de formación que te aseguramos que te va a gustar y mucho.
Creemos en tu desarrollo profesional. Lo cuidamos con un modelo de talento donde podrás evolucionar a través de la experiencia, logros y habilidades que irás adquiriendo dentro de Next.
Contrato indefinido en una compañía 100% digital, tecnológica y en un grupo financiero líder internacional.
¡30 días de vacaciones al año! Jornada intensiva los viernes y dos meses de verano.
Un modelo de teletrabajo perfecto para la conciliación y disfrute de tu tiempo libre, por eso ofrecemos un modelo híbrido porque el trabajo en remoto nos gusta y mucho. Además, tenemos horario flexible de entrada y salida para que seas tú quien decida cómo organizar tu tiempo.
Ayudas para familiares con discapacidad gracias a nuestro Programa Plan Familia de la Fundación Adecco.
Tendrás ayuda alimentaria y ayuda a gastos de teletrabajo.
Dispondrás de un sistema de retribución flexible (transporte, seguro médico de Sanitas, Movistar...).
Ser una compañía 100% BBVA tiene sus ventajas como poder disfrutar de todos los productos financieros con condiciones especiales para empleados del Grupo (hipotecas, préstamos, tarjetas, seguros, etc.).
¿Te preguntas si tendrás visibilidad? Sí. Favorecemos que puedas asistir a eventos tanto nacionales como internacionales, así como a organizar los tuyos propios open company. Podrás participar en las iniciativas y actividades de la compañía. Y por supuesto, nuestras redes sociales están a disposición de todo el mundo para mostrar lo que vales.




Entonces… ¿Qué nos dices? ¿Hacemos match? 😉

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Project Description:

We are DXC - a Fortune 500 global IT services leader. In Bulgaria, we are among the largest employers with over 4,000 employees working on the company's entire IT portfolio. We are flexible - we provide everything you need to comfortably work from home, but we also keep our offices open for collaboration, meetings, and building a strong team spirit. We tailor everyone's development path to their individual interests through training and additional certifications.




Our experience and desire to grow, our mission, and our values ​create an environment where ambitious people become successful at home. At home - in Bulgaria.

Data Scientists are members of the Analytics team in Bulgaria. They work on different Analytics projects to give valuable insights for our clients. Our Data Scientists are working with cutting-edge technologies to deliver solutions that solve major business challenges. Some of these include Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, and Computer Vision, using: Python Pandas, NumPy, MatPlotLib, Scikit Learn, OpenCV, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Jypiter, Keras, Caffee, Spark, and others.




Here you will gain hands-on experience working with world-famous brands and Fortune 500 companies in a diverse team where everybody has a lot to contribute with - including yourself! The team is constantly growing with over 180 experts in the field.




As a member of our Data and AI team, your work can inspire change for DXC's highest-profile global customers. We live in a data-driven world where data can be leveraged for reporting & analyses and for data-driven products and applications. Our team has strong experience in Analytics solutions, Data Engineering and Data Science.




Join our Data and AI Team!




Responsibilities:

Research and develop statistical learning and machine learning models for data analysis
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
Implement statistical or other mathematical methodologies as needed for specific models or analysis
Use predictive modelling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, and targeting and other business outcomes
Mine and analyze data from various data sources to drive optimization and improvement of client needs and business strategies
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
Work with a variety of statistical computer languages to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets




Mandatory Skills Description:-

Python experience and/or any other programming language experience
University degree in Computer Science, other related areas or equivalent work experience
Desire to learn the cloud technologies and work with data
Ability to manage tasks efficiently and able to meet deadlines
Good communication skills
Highly motivated team player, willing to work in an agile environment




Nice-to-Have Skills Description:

Managed Solution: AWS SageMaker, Azure OpenAI Service, Azure ML, Studio, Databrick
ML packages: TensorFlow, MXNet, Keras, SciKitLearn, cv2, Spark MLLib, onnx, tflite
Notebook environments: Jupyter, Zeppelin
Data science general: Numpy, Pandas, Plotly, Shiny
Advanced statistical techniques and concepts: Generative AI, regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, and proper usage, etc.
Practical experience with variety of machine learning techniques: Computer vision, Clustering, Decision tree learning, Linear and Non-linear Modelling, Data Mining, Artificial neural networks, NLP, etc.




Languages:

English: B2 Upper Intermediate

Title: DATA Scientist
HTML:
Il Gruppo BCC Iccrea è il maggiore gruppo bancario cooperativo, l’unico gruppo bancario nazionale a capitale interamente italiano e il quarto gruppo bancario in Italia per attivi. Oggi il Gruppo è costituito da 114 Banche di Credito Cooperativo, presenti in oltre 1.700 comuni italiani con quasi 2.500 sportelli, e da altre società bancarie, finanziarie e strumentali controllate da BCC Banca Iccrea.


La Capogruppo BCC Banca Iccrea cerca una risorsa da inserire nel ruolo di Data Scientist per l’Unità Organizzativa HR Operations all’interno dell’Area Chief Operating Officer per gestire il piano di Intelligenza Artificiale, guidare la prioritizzazione degli use case e definire le scelte metodologiche per lo sviluppo dei modelli, con l’intento di massimizzare la riusabilità, la flessibilità e la scalabilità delle soluzioni.

La persona verrà inserita nella sede di Roma.


In particolare, la persona si occuperà di:


  • Lavorare su progetti all'avanguardia, collaborando con team multidisciplinari per sviluppare soluzioni AI scalabili e trasformative;
  • sviluppare, implementare e ottimizzare modelli di machine learning e intelligenza artificiale per risolvere problemi aziendali complessi;
  • analizzare grandi dataset per estrarre informazioni utili, identificare pattern, tendenze e correlazioni;
  • collaborare con sviluppatori, data scientist e stakeholder interni per integrare soluzioni AI nei processi aziendali esistenti;
  • monitorare le prestazioni dei modelli AI e implementare miglioramenti per garantirne l'efficacia e l'affidabilità;
  • ricercare e testare nuove tecnologie AI per mantenere l'azienda al passo con le innovazioni del settore.


Requisiti:


  • Laurea in disciplina ingegneristica/informatica, Statistica, Matematica/fisica;
  • 3-5 anni di esperienza nella gestione di progetti complessi in ambito AI, machine learning e data analysis;
  • ottima conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione come Python, R, e utilizzo dei principali framework di machine learning e deep learning (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn);
  • competenza nell’uso di strumenti di Business Intelligence (BI) e piattaforme di cloud computing (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud);
  • esperienza con tecnologie big data (ad esempio Hadoop, Spark);
  • requisito preferenziale esperienza in progettazione e sviluppo di modelli AI;
  • buona padronanza delle metodologie di lavoro agile (Scrum, Kanban);
  • competenze avanzate in Excel e PowerPoint per l'analisi e la presentazione dei risultati;
  • capacità di applicare tecniche per il tuning e il miglioramento continuo dei modelli AI;
  • ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese ;
  • capacità di analisi e sintesi, problem solving, orientamento al cliente, lavoro in gruppo.


In caso di interesse, leggi attentamente l'informativa sulla privacy riportata nell'area Privacy del sito web di BCC Banca Iccrea e invia la tua candidatura allegando il cv. Ti ricordiamo che, ai sensi dell’art. 111-bis del Codice Privacy, non è necessaria l’autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali presenti nel tuo cv.


La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006 ed è aperta a candidature di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il Gruppo BCC Iccrea riconosce che l'attenzione delle diversità, l’inclusione e la tutela dell’equilibrio fra vita privata e vita professionale siano principi fondamentali di creazione di valore per il Gruppo stesso.

Title: Data scientist Junior & Senior
Description:
En QUANT AI LAB, seguimos creciendo para desarrollar las más avanzadas soluciones de inteligencia artificial y analíticas del mercado, siempre desde la vanguardia y unos conocimientos técnicos asentados. Unirse a QUANT AI LAB significa unirse a una aventura donde cada miembro es una parte importante de este proyecto, y cada parte resulta esencial para hacerlo realidad.




Como parte de nuestra continua apuesta por el progreso, estamos buscando reforzar nuestra división especializada en el desarrollo de soluciones analítico-cognitivas avanzadas y de vanguardia con la incorporación de varios perfiles de alto nivel, experiencia y conocimiento técnico en las líneas priorizadas más abajo.




El objetivo de esta división es doble: 1) contribuir al desarrollo de productos y soluciones propias de la compañía; y 2) apoyar y asistir a nuestros clientes en su apuesta por estas tecnologías, trabajando codo con codo en el desarrollo de soluciones innovadoras específicamente aplicadas a su contexto de negocio.




Estamos buscando reforzar nuestra división de élite de Inteligencia Artificial con varios Data Scientist con +3 años de experiencia, que posean un profundo y sólido conocimiento de las técnicas de inteligencia artificial, su diseño, conceptualización, desarrollo y puesta en producción. Estas personas se incorporarán a un equipo de élite y de grandes profesionales, para abordar proyectos avanzados de analítica e inteligencia artificial, trabajando con algunas de las tecnologías más avanzadas del momento, y con impacto internacional.




Entre las funciones de este equipo se encuentran:




Conceptualización, diseño e implementación de soluciones de inteligencia artificial con impacto directo en nuestros clientes.
Gestión de alcance, proyectos, desarrollos y entregables.
Implementación de las redes y algoritmos necesarios según los requerimientos del problema.
Participación de forma activa en el diseño y desarrollo de los procesos asociados a servicios analítico-cognitivos.
Participación en el diseño, desarrollo e integración.
Identificación de nuevas tecnologías, tendencias y soluciones que permitan ofrecer la máxima calidad y eficiencia de las soluciones.
Coordinación y colaboración con los equipos de Data Science para la implementación y puesta en producción de la solución.
Colaboración con el resto del equipo de Data e IA, formado por algunos de los mejores Data Scientist, Data Engineers, e investigadores del país.
Velar por la calidad de los desarrollos y limpieza del código (Clean Code), manteniendo los más altos estándares calidad y rigurosidad.
Proactividad y resolución de problemas.




Las competencias y conocimientos del candidato son:




Imprescindible




Preferible graduado en informática, o titulación técnica superior similar (matemáticas, físicas..).
Máster en Inteligencia Artificial. Se valora muy positivamente el doctorado.
Buen nivel de inglés, oral y escrito.
Experiencia demostrable y conocimientos sólidos en Inteligencia artificial.
Experiencia trabajando en la codificación y puesta en producción de modelos analíticos y de inteligencia artificial.
Altos estándares de codificación, gestión de código (GIT), etc.
Alto nivel de SQL y Python.
Experiencia demostrable en Cloud (AWS, Azure o GCP).










Capacidades blandas




Altas capacidades de comunicación, tanto verbal como escrita.
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo, y actitud resolutiva.
Proactividad
Experiencia tratando y comunicando con clientes, y presentación de resultados.
Dinamismo, agilidad resolutiva, y propositiva de soluciones.
Proactividad, alto nivel de compromiso y cumplimiento de entregables.
Ganas de aprender, colaborar y mejorar.




Todos los candidatos podrán ser sometidos a una prueba y entrevista técnica.







QUANT AI LAB, lo que le ofrecemos:




Contribuir al desarrollo de una empresa internacional en continuo crecimiento y desarrollando proyectos y productos de vanguardia.
Integrar un equipo multidisciplinar con formación profesional y académica de alto nivel, compuesto por algunos de los mayores expertos en el área de la inteligencia artificial, analítica avanzada y tratamiento del dato.
La oportunidad de trabajar directamente con clientes de talla internacional, y algunas de las mayores compañías del país y del mundo.
Un entorno de trabajo colaborativo, emprendedor y solidario, y un equipo joven y dinámico en el que todos se apoyan para crecer juntos.
Un ambiente divertido y agradable y eventos festivos (afterworks, seminarios...).
Contrato indefinido y un salario muy competitivo, que se determinará en función del perfil y la experiencia.







Si crees que puedes aportar a nuestra unidad analítica de vanguardia estaremos encantados de conocerte.

Show more
HTML:
En QUANT AI LAB, seguimos creciendo para desarrollar las más avanzadas soluciones de inteligencia artificial y analíticas del mercado, siempre desde la vanguardia y unos conocimientos técnicos asentados. Unirse a QUANT AI LAB significa unirse a una aventura donde cada miembro es una parte importante de este proyecto, y cada parte resulta esencial para hacerlo realidad.


Como parte de nuestra continua apuesta por el progreso, estamos buscando reforzar nuestra división especializada en el desarrollo de soluciones analítico-cognitivas avanzadas y de vanguardia con la incorporación de varios perfiles de alto nivel, experiencia y conocimiento técnico en las líneas priorizadas más abajo.


El objetivo de esta división es doble: 1) contribuir al desarrollo de productos y soluciones propias de la compañía; y 2) apoyar y asistir a nuestros clientes en su apuesta por estas tecnologías, trabajando codo con codo en el desarrollo de soluciones innovadoras específicamente aplicadas a su contexto de negocio.


Estamos buscando reforzar nuestra división de élite de Inteligencia Artificial con varios Data Scientist con +3 años de experiencia, que posean un profundo y sólido conocimiento de las técnicas de inteligencia artificial, su diseño, conceptualización, desarrollo y puesta en producción. Estas personas se incorporarán a un equipo de élite y de grandes profesionales, para abordar proyectos avanzados de analítica e inteligencia artificial, trabajando con algunas de las tecnologías más avanzadas del momento, y con impacto internacional.


Entre las funciones de este equipo se encuentran:


  • Conceptualización, diseño e implementación de soluciones de inteligencia artificial con impacto directo en nuestros clientes.
  • Gestión de alcance, proyectos, desarrollos y entregables.
  • Implementación de las redes y algoritmos necesarios según los requerimientos del problema.
  • Participación de forma activa en el diseño y desarrollo de los procesos asociados a servicios analítico-cognitivos.
  • Participación en el diseño, desarrollo e integración.
  • Identificación de nuevas tecnologías, tendencias y soluciones que permitan ofrecer la máxima calidad y eficiencia de las soluciones.
  • Coordinación y colaboración con los equipos de Data Science para la implementación y puesta en producción de la solución.
  • Colaboración con el resto del equipo de Data e IA, formado por algunos de los mejores Data Scientist, Data Engineers, e investigadores del país.
  • Velar por la calidad de los desarrollos y limpieza del código (Clean Code), manteniendo los más altos estándares calidad y rigurosidad.
  • Proactividad y resolución de problemas.


Las competencias y conocimientos del candidato son:


Imprescindible


  • Preferible graduado en informática, o titulación técnica superior similar (matemáticas, físicas..).
  • Máster en Inteligencia Artificial. Se valora muy positivamente el doctorado.
  • Buen nivel de inglés, oral y escrito.
  • Experiencia demostrable y conocimientos sólidos en Inteligencia artificial.
  • Experiencia trabajando en la codificación y puesta en producción de modelos analíticos y de inteligencia artificial.
  • Altos estándares de codificación, gestión de código (GIT), etc.
  • Alto nivel de SQL y Python.
  • Experiencia demostrable en Cloud (AWS, Azure o GCP).




Capacidades blandas


  • Altas capacidades de comunicación, tanto verbal como escrita.
  • Capacidad de trabajo en equipo, y actitud resolutiva.
  • Proactividad
  • Experiencia tratando y comunicando con clientes, y presentación de resultados.
  • Dinamismo, agilidad resolutiva, y propositiva de soluciones.
  • Proactividad, alto nivel de compromiso y cumplimiento de entregables.
  • Ganas de aprender, colaborar y mejorar.


Todos los candidatos podrán ser sometidos a una prueba y entrevista técnica.



QUANT AI LAB, lo que le ofrecemos:


  • Contribuir al desarrollo de una empresa internacional en continuo crecimiento y desarrollando proyectos y productos de vanguardia.
  • Integrar un equipo multidisciplinar con formación profesional y académica de alto nivel, compuesto por algunos de los mayores expertos en el área de la inteligencia artificial, analítica avanzada y tratamiento del dato.
  • La oportunidad de trabajar directamente con clientes de talla internacional, y algunas de las mayores compañías del país y del mundo.
  • Un entorno de trabajo colaborativo, emprendedor y solidario, y un equipo joven y dinámico en el que todos se apoyan para crecer juntos.
  • Un ambiente divertido y agradable y eventos festivos (afterworks, seminarios...).
  • Contrato indefinido y un salario muy competitivo, que se determinará en función del perfil y la experiencia.



Si crees que puedes aportar a nuestra unidad analítica de vanguardia estaremos encantados de conocerte.

Title: Data Scientist | Lisboa
HTML:
A Decskill nasceu em 2014 como uma Empresa de Consultoria em Tecnologia da Informação e com a premissa que o seu maior ativo são as suas pessoas. Com o propósito de criar valor através do conhecimento e do talento, a Decskill promove uma cultura de excelência e investe no desenvolvimento e bem-estar dos colaboradores. Com mais de 600 profissionais dedicados e escritórios em Lisboa, Porto, Madrid e Luxemburgo, a Decskill atua hoje em três áreas de negócio:


• Decskill Talent: Acreditamos que as nossas pessoas são fundamentais para o nosso sucesso de todos. Através da Decskill Talent, capacitamos e acompanhamos equipas em desafios da transformação digital dos nossos clientes. Colaboramos com os clientes na sua estratégia de transição digital e inovação, garantindo o sucesso do projeto e o crescimento do negócio.


• Decskill Boost: O nosso compromisso com o talento estende-se a novos modelos de desenvolvimento e colaboração. Dotando a nossa equipa com as mais recentes ferramentas, metodologias e melhores práticas, otimizamos o Time-to-Market e entregamos soluções inovadoras que superam expectativas do cliente.


• Decskill Connect: Na Decskill Connect, a equipa Decskill colabora de perto com os clientes para implementar e gerir infraestruturas de tecnologia da informação que geram valor a longo prazo.


O sucesso da Decskill é construído pelo foco nas nossas pessoas e pela capacidade de enfrentar os desafios da transformação digital com agilidade e flexibilidade. Criamos valor não só para os nossos clientes, mas também para todo o nosso ecossistema onde fomentamos uma comunidade digital dedicada ao crescimento dos negócios através da tecnologia.


Procuramos um Data Scientist para um projeto híbrido em Lisboa.


Requisitos:

  • Experiência prévia na função;
  • Experiência com bases de dados relacionais e NoSQL;
  • Experiência no desenvolvimento de projetos de machine learning (Python, R ou SAS), no deployment de modelos para ambientes de produção e gestão do ciclo de vida de modelos;
  • Conhecimento dos modelos analíticos de complexidade média (regressão, classificação, clustering, machine learning sobre dados estruturados 'at rest');
  • Experiência com implementação de soluções interativas de visualização de dados para apresentação de resultados complexos (valorizado);
  • Conhecimento em Generative AI (valorizado);
  • Fluência em inglês.



Se a oportunidade corresponde às suas expectativas envie-nos o seu CV para o email catia.carvalho@decskill.com, com a referência “CC/DS”


A Decskill assume um compromisso de igualdade e não discriminação com todos os seus talentos. Recrutamos e promovemos talento, com base na diversidade e inclusão, independentemente da idade, género, etnia, raça, nacionalidade ou qualquer outra forma de discriminação incompatível com a dignidade da pessoa humana.

Title: Junior Engineer Machine Learning / Deep Learning (w/m/d)
Description:
Im Data Analytics Team der HUK-COBURG transformieren wir Daten in echte Mehrwerte für über 13 Mio. Kund:innen. Als Deutschlands führende Kfz-Versicherung sind wir ein traditionsreiches und stabiles Unternehmen, welches zielgerichtet in Innovation und seine datengetriebene Zukunft investiert. Unsere agilen Data Analytics Teams setzen modernste Machine Learning und KI-Methoden ein, um Prozesse zu optimieren, faire Preise zu berechnen, Schäden digital und intelligent zu steuern und um neue, innovative Versicherungsprodukte zu entwickeln.




Werde Teil unserer großen Data-Community, entwickle gemeinsam mit vielen weiteren, erfahrenen Datenspezialist:innen praxisnahe Machine Learning-Anwendungen und gestalte so den durch Daten, Machine Learning und KI getriebenen Wandel bei einem der größten Versicherer Deutschlands mit.




Diese Aufgaben warten auf Dich




Anwenden moderner Machine Learning Engineering Workflows auf praktische Unternehmensanforderungen
Entwicklung, Implementierung und fortlaufende Aktualisierung von Machine Learning und Deep Learning Services
Kontinuierliche betriebliche Begleitung der entwickelten Services
Learning by Doing: Skillaufbau mittels Rotation durch unterschiedliche Projekte/Bereiche und Zusammenarbeit mit Senior Scientists (w/m/d)
Kontinuierliche Weiterbildung und Spezialisierung als Machine Learning Engineer (w/m/d)
Teamarbeit in einem kreativen, motivierten, interdisziplinären sowie agilen Team aus Data Scientists (w/m/d), Machine Learning Engineers (w/m/d) und Fach- sowie IT-Expert:innen zur Integration von Machine Learning- und Deep Learning-Lösungen in unsere Produkte




Das bringst Du mit




Abgeschlossenes Studium (mindestens Master) in Data Science, Machine Learning, Informatik, Physik, Mathematik oder einem verwandten Fachgebiet
Starke Programmierkenntnisse in Python und theoretische und praktische Kenntnisse in Machine Learning Engineering und MLOps-Techniken und -Tools
Idealerweise Erfahrung in der betrieblichen Begleitung von Machine Learning oder Deep Learning basierten Services
Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, technische Konzepte klar zu vermitteln
Selbstständige, zielorientierte Arbeitsweise mit hoher Eigenverantwortung und Bereitschaft, Ownership für Projekte und Ergebnisse zu übernehmen
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Bereitschaft zur Präsenz in Coburg
Gute Deutschkenntnisse (C1-Niveau)




Wir bieten Dir




Flexibles Arbeiten: Im Rahmen unseres hybriden Arbeitskonzeptes kannst du von zu Hause, unterwegs oder am Hauptsitz in Coburg arbeiten.
Kompetenz: Wir fördern deine konsequente fachliche Weiterbildung in Form von Schulungen, Konferenzen und allem was dich weiterbringt.
Gestaltungsfreiheit: Wir vertrauen deinen Fähigkeiten und geben dir den Raum, eigene Ideen und Lösungen voranzutreiben.
Leistungsorientierte Vergütung: Wir sehen und schätzen deinen Beitrag zum Erfolg des Unternehmens und lassen dich daran teilhaben.
Sicherheit: Mit der Stärke unserer Tradition setzen wir auf Erfolg und bieten dir Sicherheit.




Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!




Mehr Informationen zu unserem Data Analytics Programm findest Du hier: huk.de/da




Informationen zur Verarbeitung von Bewerber:innen-Daten:

https://www.huk.de/content/dam/hukde/dokumente/datenschutz/informationen-verarbeitung-bewerberdaten-hc.pdf

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to build a better future?




About Enfinity Global

Enfinity Global is a purpose-driven company focused on making a positive impact on the planet by helping companies, governments, and individuals transition to a carbon-free and sustainable economy. Our role as a leading IPP is to develop, finance, build, operate, and own renewable energy assets in the long term in Europe, Asia, and the Americas through our offices in the USA, Spain, Italy, UK, Netherlands, India, and Japan.




Our team of over 250 Enfiniters comprises seasoned finance professionals, as well as experienced project developers and operators with extensive industry experience across all stages of the project life cycle. We pride ourselves on being creative and innovative solution providers to our customers and partners.




We’re looking for a Data Scientis to join our Team in Milan.




Main task and duties:




Responsibilities:

· Analyze large datasets from energy production, prices, and consumption to uncover insights and trends

· Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms to optimize energy usage and forecasting (e.g., renewable energy production, demand forecasting)

· Create data visualizations and dashboards to communicate key findings to top management

· Assist in building and refining energy price models, optimization strategies, and risk assessment tools

· Perform data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering to prepare data for analysis

· Work closely with market intelligence team to provide actionable insights

· Stay current with trends and innovations in data science and energy markets







Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field

· Strong understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning, and data modeling techniques

· Proficiency in Python

· Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI

· Familiarity with SQL for data querying and database management

· Knowledge of energy markets, renewable energy, or sustainability is a plus (but not required)

· Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment

· Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights




In Enfinity Global group you will find a very dynamic and multinational environment in one of the most exciting and impactful industries. Here we will foster your professional and personal growth, and you will have the opportunity to actively contribute and make a real impact on climate change.




Let’s build our future together.







Visit www.enfinity.global to discover more about our culture and values.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Graduate Data Scientist

Location: Munich, Germany

Salary: €50,000 - €60,000 per year




Are you a recent graduate passionate about unlocking the power of data? We are recruiting on behalf of a dynamic team in Munich and who are looking to kickstart your career as a Graduate Data Scientist in a thriving, innovative environment.




What You'll Do:




Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze large datasets and extract actionable insights.
Develop, test, and optimize machine learning models to solve real-world business challenges.
Build data pipelines and automation workflows to enhance operational efficiency.
Create engaging visualizations and reports to present findings to stakeholders.
Continuously research and implement the latest tools and methodologies in data science.




What We’re Looking For:




A degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
Strong programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages.
Knowledge of SQL and experience working with databases.
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.
An analytical mindset and excellent problem-solving skills.
Enthusiasm for data and eagerness to learn and grow.




What We Offer:




The client value their employees and believe in rewarding them with exceptional benefits, including:




Leading Paid Leave: Generous vacation days and additional wellness days.
Flexible Work Options: Hybrid work model with the flexibility to balance office and remote work.
Health and Wellness: Comprehensive private health insurance and access to wellness programs.
Professional Growth: Access to world-class training, certifications, and industry events.
State-of-the-Art Equipment: Latest tech tools and resources to support your work.
Relocation Assistance: For candidates moving to Munich, we provide relocation support and housing assistance.
Team Bonding: Regular team outings, hackathons, and company events.
Green Commuting: Subsidized public transportation or company-sponsored bike schemes.




Why Join Us?




We’re a forward-thinking company at the intersection of technology and innovation. Our diverse team is committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive work culture where you can grow, make an impact, and truly enjoy your work.

Title: Data Scientist | MAPFRE
HTML:
QUEM SOMOS?

Uma das maiores seguradoras do mundo, temos como pilar a sustentabilidade e o cuidado com as pessoas. Possuímos um amplo portfólio de produtos e diversas unidades em que atuamos: Investimentos, Consórcios, Capitalização, Previdência e Vida Resgatável, Saúde, Seguros e Assistência.

Com presença em mais de 100 países nos cinco continentes, somamos mais de 34 mil colaboradores em todo o mundo, mais de 300 em Portugal.

Trabalhamos para construir o futuro e estamos comprometidos com a inovação.

Estamo-nos a transformar para acompanhar os nossos clientes também no mundo digital.

A Fundación MAPFRE, instituição sem fins lucrativos, é a nossa acionista maioritária, o que fortalece a nossa independência e estabilidade. Entre os nossos compromissos está a valorização e apoio à diversidade e inclusão, construindo ambientes mais acolhedores. A presença de mulheres em cargo de gestão e o equilíbrio racial e de género na constituição das equipas é a nossa prioridade.


O QUE VAIS FAZER

  • Como Data Scientist terás um papel crucial na transformação que estamos a viver na MAPFRE Portugal para ser uma empresa data-driven, gerindo os dados como um ativo estratégico ao longo de todo o seu ciclo de vida, desde a aquisição até à ativação. Farás parte de uma equipa multidisciplinar, e trabalharás de forma próxima com a equipa de engenharia de dados e desenvolvimento de projetos. A nossa missão enquanto equipa será entender os problemas que os nossos colegas das diversas áreas de negócio nos apresentam e oferecer soluções baseadas em dados e modelos preditivos. Também esperamos que possas propor ideias que tenham um impacto positivo no negócio.


O QUE A MAPFRE ESPERA DE TI

  • Formação Superior Técnica em Engenharia, Matemática, Física, Estatística ou outro campo similar. Será valorizada formação específica em ciência de dados e inteligência artificial;
  • Estatística clássica, machine learning e inteligência artificial;Nível avançado de programação. Será especialmente valorizada a experiência em Python e R;Experiência com os frameworks de ML mais conhecidos (Sklearn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).Conhecimentos de SAS Guide ou Miner (preferencial);
  • Conhecimento de ambientes Cloud, principalmente em ambientes de GCP, Azure ou AWS. Certificações associadas serão valorizadas;Será levado em consideração o conhecimento de ferramentas específicas de visualização e exploração de dados (PowerBI);Será valorizada experiência específica na indústria de seguros;
  • Capacidade de comunicação de conceitos complexos de forma simples a clientes internos e externos;
  • Conhecimento de metodologias Agile;
  • Trabalho colaborativo e espírito curioso.


PRINCIPAIS ATIVIDADES

  • Desenvolvimento de modelos e soluções analíticas ao longo de todo o seu ciclo de vida, desde o entendimento da oportunidade/problema de negócio e o design da solução até à industrialização, implementação e avaliação dos resultados;Trabalhar de forma colaborativa com os todos os departamentos e áreas da empresa envolvidas nos nossos projetos, especialmente as áreas de negócios responsáveis pelos processos a serem otimizados;
  • Impulsionar e apoiar a análise de dados por parte dos utilizadores, com modelos analíticos baseados em auto atendimento;
  • Assegurar que os requisitos analíticos e técnicos do desenvolvimento estão alinhados com os objetivos de negócio;
  • Garantir o impacto dos casos de uso realizados na conta de resultados e nos objetivos estratégicos da empresa (conversão, retenção, sinistralidade, etc.);
  • Exploração e modelação das diversas fontes de dados da empresa e fontes de dados externas para apoiar o desenvolvimento de projetos baseados em dados;
  • Manter-se atualizado sobre as tendências e melhores práticas do mercado.


CUIDAMOS DOS NOSSOS

A MAPFRE é feita de pessoas, por isso retribuímos da melhor maneira possível o comprometimento dos nossos colaboradores, que contam com:

  • Colaborador direto MAPFRE
  • Remuneração fixa mais prémio anual
  • Carga de trabalho: 35h/semanais
  • 25 dias de férias anuais
  • Horário flexível
  • Cartão refeição;
  • Seguro de Vida
  • Seguro de Saúde;
  • Incentivo à Previdência Privada, pensando na tranquilidade do seu futuro;
  • Cursos e formações presenciais e E-learning na nossa plataforma digital, Universidade Corporativa MAPFRE. Lembrando que a MAPFRE é uma empresa global, o crescimento vai além das barreiras territoriais! ! A MAPFRE Portugal tem muito a oferecer em termos de formação transversal dentro do trabalho de um atuário. Estamos inseridos num Grupo onde a excelência técnica é estratégica, faz da nossa área um centro de alto rendimento e de formação integral como poucos deve haver em Portugal.
  • Possibilidade de integrar o nosso programa de voluntariado

Title: HR Data Scientist
Description:
We offer:




- An endless amount of interesting, complex business challenges

- A chance to influence a talent agenda that impacts over 80K employees

- A collegial atmosphere to deliver innovative solutions supported by a world-class team

- A supportive and vibrant multinational environment, we accept individual differences and believe in collaborative team working

- Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

- Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




- Construct and refine machine learning and statistical models to answer research questions relevant to informing business strategy related to workforce and talent analytics

- Collaborate on the creation and refinement of GenAI-based solutions to enhance internal HR processes.

- Ensure the operational and functional excellence of existing solutions to deliver a seamless client experience.

- Influence dashboard development and research roadmaps to improve client self-service and automation

- Work closely with HR colleagues and business stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver impactful analytics solutions.




You have:




- You hold a BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Economics, or a related quantitative field.

- Professional experience in data science, statistics, or social science research

- You are skilled in Python (essential), SQL, and preferably in business intelligence tools. You understand various data sources and technologies such as relational databases, data lakes, and APIs.

- You are familiar with DevOps principles including version control, Git, CI/CD and basic Linux commands.

- You possess strong interpersonal skills and can effectively communicate complex data-driven insights to diverse audiences.

- Experience with natural language processing, large language models, and/or generative AI is a plus.

- You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.




Team profile:




Join our Budapest Analytics Center of Excellence, a key component of Morgan Stanley's global HR Analytics team. Our team is charged with delivering innovative solutions and insights in people analytics. HR Analytics was recognized as one of Morgan Stanley's Top 3 Strategic People Initiatives in 2020, we offer a fast-paced, high-impact environment ideal for those ready to dive in and make a significant contribution.

We are excited to learn more about you! Apply now to join our team and start making a difference with your analytical skills and insights.




About us:




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services.

Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are helping to shape the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management and Data & Analytics.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Procuras dar um passo na tua carreira nas áreas de IT e Telecomunicações?




Então chegaste ao sítio certo – à Smart! A tecnologia, a transformação e a inovação fazem parte do nosso ADN. Somos uma empresa de consultoria tecnológica com mais de uma década de experiência no desenvolvimento de projetos nacionais e internacionais em IT e Telecomunicações e queremos fazer parte da tua história.




O que é preciso para seres um SMART Data Scientist?

Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática ou similar
Experiência profissional como Data Scientist
Experiência com R, Python, Java ou Scala
Experiência com base de dados não relacionais
Boa capacidade de comunicação
Flexibilidade e dinamismo
Inglês




Porquê ser SMART?

Tornamos reais os projetos em que participamos
Amamos o que fazemos, e temos orgulho no resultado do nosso trabalho
Somos simples e eficientes
Valorizamos as nossas pessoas
Somos uma equipa dinâmica, íntegra e de confiança




Onde podes ser SMART?

Lisboa

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Wij zijn een toonaangevend digital agency en bouwen aan een gloednieuwe data & AI-afdeling. Ter versterking van ons team zijn we op zoek naar een veelzijdige Data & AI Scientist die niet alleen klantprojecten oppakt, maar ook de interne werkwijze binnen de afdeling helpt vormgeven en verder uitbouwt.

Wat ga je doen?

Als Data & AI Scientist werk je nauw samen met onze klanten om hun digitale vraagstukken te vertalen naar datagedreven oplossingen. Je helpt bij het ontwerpen, bouwen en beheren van data- en AI-oplossingen, en adviseert zowel extern (klanten) als intern (collega’s) over de beste aanpak. Daarnaast speel je een sleutelrol in het bepalen van de “way of work” binnen onze nieuwe data & AI-afdeling, denk hierbij aan methodieken, processen en tools die nodig zijn om succesvol te blijven in een snel veranderende markt. Verantwoordelijkheden die hierbij komen kijken zijn o.a.:


Klantcontact & projectmanagement:
Fungeren als aanspreekpunt voor klanten, waarbij je hun behoeften in kaart brengt en vertaalt naar concrete data- en AI-projecten
Meewerken aan het opstellen van projectplannen, begrotingen en tijdslijnen en de voortgang bewaken
Data-infrastructuur & engineering:
Ontwerpen en implementeren van schaalbare data-architecturen en data pipelines (ETL/ELT)
Waarborgen van datakwaliteit, -beveiliging en -integriteit binnen verschillende klantomgevingen
Data-analyse & AI-modellen:
Uitvoeren van geavanceerde analyses, data-exploratie en het bouwen van machine learning-modellen (bijv. voorspellende modellen, NLP, computer vision)
Visualiseren van resultaten in dashboards en rapportages, en deze op een heldere manier presenteren aan zowel technische als niet-technische doelgroepen
Innovatie & strategie:
Actief bijdragen aan het vormgeven van processen, methodieken en best practices voor onze data & AI-afdeling
Op de hoogte blijven van nieuwe tools, technieken en trends binnen data science en AI, en deze vertalen naar kansen voor onze klanten en onze eigen organisatie
Kennisdeling & samenwerking:
Nauwe samenwerking met multidisciplinaire teams (Software development, marketing, performance) en coaching van collega’s op het gebied van data- en AI-technologieën
Zorgen voor een cultuur van continu leren en verbeteren binnen de afdeling
Waar ga je dat doen?

Endeavour is the place to be voor wie op topniveau wil werken bij een full service digital agency. Wij zijn een team van 150 avonturiers die niet alleen focussen op het resultaat, maar ook op de weg daar naartoe. We houden van experimenteren en ontdekken. Van leren en bijsturen. Van hard werken en hard spelen. Of je hart nu ligt bij marketing of tech; je vindt altijd mensen die jouw liefde voor het vak delen en je uitdagen om te groeien en te leren.

Je gaat werken in het Endeavour HQ, op 500 meter afstand van station Haarlem. We zitten in een oud fabriekspand, dat net even wat meer creatieve vibe heeft dan een ‘gewoon’ kantoorpand, maar wel met de modernste faciliteiten! Onze favoriete onderdelen zijn het dakterras (top voor borrels in de zon), de barista corner, de bar met DJ booth en de pooltafel!

Jij:


Afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in een relevante richting (bijv. Informatica, Wiskunde, Data Science, Statistiek)
Meerdere jaren ervaring in een rol als Data Analyst, Data Scientist of Data Engineer, bij voorkeur bij een digital agency of consultancy
Aantoonbare ervaring met programmeertalen zoals Python, R en SQL, en data-engineering tools (bijv. Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, Airflow)
Kennis van BI- en visualisatietools (bijv. Power BI, Tableau, Looker) en ervaring met cloudomgevingen (AWS, Azure of GCP)
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en gevoel voor klantgericht werken; je kunt complexe materie begrijpelijk maken voor diverse doelgroepen
Proactief, ondernemend en enthousiast om samen met ons de data & AI-afdeling op te bouwen en te optimaliseren


Wat bieden we jou?

Bij Endeavour krijg je de mogelijkheid om je talenten te benutten en nog verder te ontwikkelen. En verder:


Een competitief salaris met aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden
24 vakantiedagen bij een fulltime dienstverband, en daarnaast de mogelijkheid om de standaard nationale feestdagen om te zetten naar vrije dagen op momenten die voor jou belangrijk zijn. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan Chinees Nieuwjaar, Eid el fitr, Jom Kipoer of Gay Pride
De kans om mee te bouwen aan een relatief nieuw team binnen een gerenommeerde full service agency
Een functie met veel verantwoordelijkheid en vrijheid
Een werkplek op een waanzinnige en unieke locatie in Haarlem
Een informele omgeving met enthousiaste, gedreven collega’s
Een budget voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling
Een goede pensioenregeling
De mogelijkheid om flexibele werktijden aan te houden


Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Scientist for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

  • A higher education degree (BAC+5 level) with a specialization in Data Science;
  • At least 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist;
  • You are proficient in Python and API integration;
  • Solid knowledge of Big Data technologies (Hadoop) and AI, including Named Entity Recognition (NER), Natural Language Processing (NLP), computer vision and clustering.
  • You have a strong passion for artificial intelligence and demonstrate excellent teamwork skills;
  • Your rigor, organizational abilities and motivation to tackle complex challenges set you apart;
  • Fluent English (mandatory);
  • The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Si te consideras una persona analítica, autónoma y proactiva, con gran capacidad de comunicación y con un inglés fluido, tenemos una oportunidad para ti en nuestras oficinas de Barcelona.




Como Data Scientist, contribuirás en la gestión de proyectos de Machine Learning en entorno Cloud, en contacto con stakeholders para desarrollar modelados estadísticos y predictivos.




Tus funciones principales serán…




Implementar productos Machine Learning en entorno Cloud (Snowflake, Azure, Amazon Sagemaker,..) sobre grandes volúmenes de datos y posterior seguimiento para garantizar la mejora continua de su rendimiento.
Desarrollar y producir técnicas avanzadas de modelado estadístico y predictivo, trabajando en estrecha colaboración con los stakeholders.
Tomar requerimientos con negocio, ejecutar e implantar proyectos analíticos.
Dar seguimiento a todo el ciclo de vida de los proyectos: implicar y coordinar a los equipos internos y externos, estimar los recursos y tiempos para el desarrollo de las tareas, comunicar las soluciones analíticas a los stakeholders e implementar mejoras.
Desarrollar nuevos e innovadores enfoques para resolver problemas analíticos.




¿Qué buscamos?




Ingeniería Superior en Matemáticas, Estadística, Informática y Telecomunicaciones.
Experiencia de al menos 2 años como Data Scientist.
Experiencia en el desarrollo de Modelos Predictivos y de Machine Learning.
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas ML (Phyton, SQL, R,…)
Nivel fluido de inglés.
Habilidades de comunicación, trabajo en equipo, mente abierta.
Capacidad de análisis.
Capacidad de autonomía y proactividad.
Además, se valorará positivamente:
Experiencia con herramientas data discovery y data preparation.
Experiencia en el deployment de proyectos de IA/ Machine Learning.
Experiencia de forma activa en procesos de transformación de una compañía hacia una Data Driven Company.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?




4-day work-week: trabajamos 34 horas dentro de una semana laboral de 4 días para potenciar la creatividad y la conciliación. Además, contamos con flexibilidad horaria de entrada y salida.
Oficinas abiertas al mar: estamos en la Barceloneta frente al Mar Mediterráneo. Las vistas nos inspiran y el entorno nos permite disfrutar de una vida saludable: hacer deporte, llegar en bicicleta o caminando o comer al aire libre.
Podrás flexibilizar tu salario destinándolo a servicios como seguro de salud, transporte, guardería y comida. Además podrás disfrutar de café, infusiones y fruta fresca cada día.
Desigualiza tu armario: tendrás un 50% de descuento en nuestras colecciones.




¡En DESIGUAL estamos deseando conocerte!

Title: Junior Data Scientist (Remote)
Description:
Embark on a career in data science with Kreativstorm, a leading management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and turn data into actionable insights!

Are you passionate about data and eager to uncover insights that drive business decisions? Kreativstorm is looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our team. You will analyze and interpret complex datasets, develop predictive models, and collaborate with the data team to extract insights. This role offers an excellent opportunity to develop your analytical skills and make a significant impact.

Job Overview and Details:


Location: Fully Remote
Position: Full-Time


Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Pursuing or having a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Junior data scientists with a strong interest in data analysis and machine learning.
Proficiency in data science tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Your Role:


Analyze and interpret complex datasets.
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms.
Collaborate with the data team to extract insights and inform decisions.
Document and present data science findings.
Support in implementing data-driven solutions.


Benefits

Why Join Us? Kreativstorm offers a dynamic and innovative environment. You will work with a team of data experts, gaining hands-on experience in data science and machine learning. We value creativity, collaboration, and data-driven decision-making. Join us to enhance your data science skills and contribute to the success of our clients.

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data science!


Show more

Requirements

Ideal Candidates:

  • Pursuing or having a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Junior data scientists with a strong interest in data analysis and machine learning.
  • Proficiency in data science tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Your Role:

  • Analyze and interpret complex datasets.
  • Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms.
  • Collaborate with the data team to extract insights and inform decisions.
  • Document and present data science findings.
  • Support in implementing data-driven solutions.

Benefits

Why Join Us? Kreativstorm offers a dynamic and innovative environment. You will work with a team of data experts, gaining hands-on experience in data science and machine learning. We value creativity, collaboration, and data-driven decision-making. Join us to enhance your data science skills and contribute to the success of our clients.

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data science!

Title: Data Scientist - Prima
Description:
At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you’d be in the driving seat of your career; learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is — your voice is valued. We are passionate about shaping the future of insurance with a strong commitment to innovation, collaboration, and inclusivity. Since 2015, we've focused on delivering affordable, customer-centered car insurance while fostering a culture where every voice is valued.

We are now hiring for a Data Scientist to join our Pricing team and play a critical role in our journey to become the world's leading insurance provider.

In this role, you will be at the forefront of our predictive pricing strategy, using data analytics, AI, and machine learning to drive our competitive advantage. We look for curious and proactive individuals with strong foundations in mathematics, programming, and machine learning. While prior experience isn’t required, we value a genuine enthusiasm for innovation and analytical challenges.

If you're ready to make an impact in a supportive environment that emphasizes growth, autonomy, and well-being, join us and help shape the future at Prima!




Your main responsibilities

The main responsibility of the Data Scientist in Prima’s Pricing team is to harness the power of data analytics, AI, and machine learning to drive predictive pricing strategies. You’ll be tasked with analyzing large datasets to anticipate market trends, evaluate client risk, and set competitive pricing that aligns with our growth goals. This role is essential to building and maintaining Prima’s competitive edge in the insurance industry by providing data-driven insights that guide strategic decisions.

In addition to technical analysis, you’ll collaborate closely with other departments, ensuring that pricing models are aligned with broader business objectives and continuously optimized. Your work will directly impact Prima’s success, contributing to our mission to become a top global insurance provider.

Here a recap:

Develop predictive pricing models using data analytics, AI, and machine learning to enhance Prima’s competitive edge.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, evaluate client risk, and inform pricing strategies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align pricing models with overall business goals and ensure data-driven decision-making.




Requirements for this position

Here are the key requirements for the Data Scientist position at Prima:




Academic Background: Strong academic achievements in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Analytical Skills: Exceptional quantitative, logical, and analytical abilities to tackle complex data challenges.
Programming & Machine Learning: Solid foundation in programming (Python or similar) and experience with machine learning techniques.
Data Manipulation: Proficiency in data mining languages such as MySQL or Redshift to create and manage datasets.
Curiosity and Innovation: A proactive mindset, with a drive for curiosity and problem-solving in a collaborative environment.
International Experience: Previous international experience is a plus, supporting Prima’s global perspective.




Candidates do not need prior work experience, as Prima is committed to investing in early-career talent and growth.




Your compensation

Prima offers a range of compensation and benefits designed to support employee well-being, growth, and work-life balance. Key benefits include:

Flexible Work Arrangements: Prima values work-life balance, offering flexibility between office and remote work and an annual 30-day work-from-anywhere policy.
Professional Development: Access to a teaching and learning marketplace and regular growth sessions with managers to build a personalized career plan.
Health and Well-being Support: Comprehensive private medical insurance, discounted gym memberships, and well-being initiatives to help maintain a healthy lifestyle.
Supportive Work Environment: Prima fosters an inclusive, high-performing culture where diversity is celebrated, and equal employment opportunities are a priority.




Languages

Required (fluent)

Italian

Valuable

English




A typical day in this position

Have you ever wondered what a day in the life of a Data Scientist at Prima is like?

Giacomo Testa, Head of Pricing and Underwriting Italy, will guide you on a journey to discover our world, giving you an up-close look at his team.

https://www.linkedin.com/posts/prima-assicurazioni_ti-sei-mai-chiesto-come-si-svolge-la-activity-7163128398834348032-vZrl/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop

Title: Data Science
Description:
Seargin is a dynamic multinational tech company operating in 50 countries. At Seargin, we drive innovation and create projects that shape the future and greatly enhance the quality of life. You will find our solutions in the space industry, supporting scientists in the development of cancer drugs, and implementing innovative technological solutions for industrial clients worldwide. These are just some of the areas in which we operate.




Currently, for the new Seargin project, we are looking for Data Science.




About the job

Form: B2B contract
Location: Remote from Poland/Spain




Key responsibilities:

- Plan and conceive data science projects.

Interpret and analyze data problems.
Visualize data and create reports.
Experiment with new models and techniques.
Build analytic systems and predictive models.
Test performance of data-driven products.
Collaborate across teams to deploy solutions and drive continuous improvements.




Qualifications:




Must have:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science or related field.
Proficiency in Python programming.
Knowledge in Natural Language Processing (NLP) such as text classification.
Experience with version control systems.
Ability to work as a team player, self-starter, analytical, creative, and curious.
Strong communication skills to convey insights to the business team.




Preferred:

Experience with AWS cloud services (e.g., S3, SageMaker, Lambda, Comprehend).
Knowledge of building Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.
Experience in building Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) pipelines.
Familiarity with test-driven development. Critical thinking skills.
Domain knowledge in customer experience or marketing & sales.







Discover the Power of IT Excellence. Apply!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client’s needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client’s needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)…
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java …
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Scientist (H/F)
Description:
Chez Withings, nous souhaitons redonner aux individus le contrôle de leur santé.

Nous avons l'obsession de créer des produits beaux et intuitifs, afin que chacun puisse les utiliser facilement au quotidien; nos balances connectées, montres hybrides, tensiomètres, moniteurs de sommeil et tous les dispositifs de notre gamme sont aujourd'hui utilisés par des millions d'utilisateurs.

Notre objectif : permettre la prévention, le dépistage et l'accompagnement d'un certain nombre de maladies chroniques via des produits et des services innovants, afin de révolutionner la manière dont on prend soin de notre santé.

Tes missions :

L'équipe MachineLearning est responsable du développement de tous les algorithmes de prédiction des produits Withings. Intégré.e en son sein, tu auras les responsabilités suivantes:


Recherche algorithmique pour analyser les données pertinentes et les partager avec l'équipe
Réalisation de prototypes par la mise en pratique des méthodes retenues
Implémentation de services sur la plateforme / produits Withings, en tenant compte des contraintes de ressources et de temps d'exécution
Mise en avant de nouvelles fonctionnalités pour les applications et produits Withings
Maintien du lien avec les équipes de Recherche Appliquée et de Développement Produit pour comprendre et exploiter les données recueillies



Requirements


Formation Bac+5 type grande école d'ingénieur ou équivalent
Un doctorat dans un domaine connexe est très apprécié
Une première expérience réussie dans le domaine du Machine Learning, de l'algorithmie appliqué aux données de santé ou à l'embarqué est fortement appréciée
Fortes compétences informatiques : calculs scientifiques, Python...
Rigueur, autonomie, prise d'initiatives, curiosité...
Connaissances en traitement de signal, C/C++ appréciées
Maîtrise parfaite de la communication en français et en anglais, aussi bien à l'écrit qu'à l'oral



Benefits

Rejoindre l'aventure Withings, c'est :


Intégrer un des pionniers et leaders mondiaux de la santé connectée, plusieurs fois primé au Consumer Electronic Show
Contribuer à des projets innovants et ambitieux pour la santé de demain dans un environnement agile et en constante évolution
Intégrer une entreprise internationale, membre de la FrenchTech 120, dont les équipes sont basées à Issy-les-Moulineaux, Boston, Hong-Kong et Shenzhen
Participer à l'amélioration continue de nos produits et services en les bêta-testant avant leur sortie, notamment lors de nos nombreuses sessions sportives entre collègues
Bénéficier de nombreux avantages : Stock Options, smartphone et ordinateur de votre choix, réductions pour des activités culturelles et sportives, restaurant d'entreprise, et bien plus encore
Participer à la Withings Med Academy en assistant à des conférences de professionnels de santé afin de renforcer ses connaissances dans le domaine médical
Collaborer avec des collègues passionnés et célébrer ensemble chacune de nos réussites !


Toutes les candidatures reçues sont étudiées indépendamment de l'origine ethnique, des croyances, de la religion, du genre, de l'orientation sexuelle ou de la santé des candidats. Withings aspire à offrir et garantir l'égalité des chances aux candidats et seules les personnes habilitées (RH et Management) auront accès aux informations concernant votre candidature.
Show more

  • Recherche algorithmique pour analyser les données pertinentes et les partager avec l'équipe
  • Réalisation de prototypes par la mise en pratique des méthodes retenues
  • Implémentation de services sur la plateforme / produits Withings, en tenant compte des contraintes de ressources et de temps d'exécution

  • Une première expérience réussie dans le domaine du Machine Learning, de l'algorithmie appliqué aux données de santé ou à l'embarqué est fortement appréciée
  • Fortes compétences informatiques : calculs scientifiques, Python...
  • Rigueur, autonomie, prise d'initiatives, curiosité...
  • Connaissances en traitement de signal, C/C++ appréciées
  • Maîtrise parfaite de la communication en français et en anglais, aussi bien à l'écrit qu'à l'oral


Benefits

Rejoindre l'aventure Withings, c'est :

  • Intégrer un des pionniers et leaders mondiaux de la santé connectée, plusieurs fois primé au Consumer Electronic Show
  • Contribuer à des projets innovants et ambitieux pour la santé de demain dans un environnement agile et en constante évolution
  • Intégrer une entreprise internationale, membre de la FrenchTech 120, dont les équipes sont basées à Issy-les-Moulineaux, Boston, Hong-Kong et Shenzhen
  • Participer à l'amélioration continue de nos produits et services en les bêta-testant avant leur sortie, notamment lors de nos nombreuses sessions sportives entre collègues
  • Bénéficier de nombreux avantages : Stock Options, smartphone et ordinateur de votre choix, réductions pour des activités culturelles et sportives, restaurant d'entreprise, et bien plus encore
  • Participer à la Withings Med Academy en assistant à des conférences de professionnels de santé afin de renforcer ses connaissances dans le domaine médical
  • Collaborer avec des collègues passionnés et célébrer ensemble chacune de nos réussites !

Toutes les candidatures reçues sont étudiées indépendamment de l'origine ethnique, des croyances, de la religion, du genre, de l'orientation sexuelle ou de la santé des candidats. Withings aspire à offrir et garantir l'égalité des chances aux candidats et seules les personnes habilitées (RH et Management) auront accès aux informations concernant votre candidature.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
We’re currently recruiting a Data Scientist for one of our partners, a fast-growing fintech in Amsterdam. In this role, you will develop advanced models to assess credit risk and contribute to maintaining a healthy portfolio. By designing and implementing these models, you’ll play a key role in predicting default probabilities, evaluating customer creditworthiness, and enhancing overall risk management strategies.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement advanced risk models to evaluate credit risk and predict default probabilities;
  • Analyze large datasets and identify patterns to continuously improve risk assessment;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate models into decision-making processes;
  • Ensure alignment of models with regulatory requirements and corporate strategies.


Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist;
  • Experience in the Risk domain;
  • Strong proficiency in Python and associated data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, scikit-learn, XGBoost);
  • Expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling techniques;
  • Familiarity with risk assessments.


What They Offer:

  • Secondary benefits (e.g. a well-structured pension plan, budget for personal development);
  • Salary scale up to €7,900 per month (€102.000,- annual gross incl.);
  • A informal environment within a fast growing organization.


Interested in this role?

The more you tell us about yourself, the better! Upload your CV and we will contact you as soon as possible!

Title: Data Scientist - Renewable energy (Mid Level)
Description:
Salary: €55,000 - €75,000 (depending on experience)

Job Title: Data Scientist

Location: Hamburg, Germany (or Hybrid or Remote from Germany)

Industry: Renewable Energy




Are you a data science professional eager to make an impact in one of the most transformative industries of our time? We are working with a leading client in the renewable energy sector who is seeking a Data Scientist to join their Hamburg-based team. This mid-level position offers the opportunity to shape the future of clean energy using advanced data analytics and machine learning.




About the Role

Our client specializes in developing AI-driven solutions for optimizing renewable energy systems, including wind, solar, and energy storage technologies. They are dedicated to creating smarter grids, increasing energy efficiency, and improving the reliability of renewable energy sources.




As a Data Scientist, you will support projects that leverage large-scale datasets from energy systems, meteorological sources, and IoT devices to improve performance, forecast energy output, and minimize operational costs. Your work will be instrumental in advancing the global energy transition.




Key Responsibilities

Develop predictive models to forecast energy production from renewable sources such as wind and solar.
Optimize the operation and maintenance of energy assets using AI and machine learning.
Analyze energy consumption patterns to design demand response strategies.
Integrate real-time data from IoT sensors into energy grid optimization systems.
Collaborate with engineers, data analysts, and energy experts to deploy advanced AI solutions.
Contribute to research initiatives focused on energy storage efficiency and grid reliability.




What They’re Looking For

Experience: 3+ years in data science, with experience in energy, utilities, or a related field preferred.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python, R, and SQL; expertise with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch); and experience working with large datasets and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).
Domain Knowledge: Understanding of renewable energy systems, grid management, or energy forecasting is an advantage.
Analytical Skills: Expertise in time-series analysis, optimization algorithms, and predictive analytics.
Education: Degree in Data Science, Engineering, Environmental Science, or a related field.
Soft Skills: Strong communication, problem-solving, and a passion for sustainability.




Why This Opportunity?

Impactful Work: Help accelerate the global transition to renewable energy and a sustainable future.
Cutting-Edge Technology: Work with advanced AI, IoT, and big data technologies to tackle complex challenges.
Career Growth: Opportunities for professional development and leadership within the company.
Attractive Benefits: Flexible working hours, annual professional development budget, Hybrid working or remote (from Germany), and access to state-of-the-art facilities.
Ideal Location: Based in Hamburg, a city known for its leadership in renewable energy innovation and vibrant tech community.




About the Client

Our client is a trailblazer in the renewable energy industry, partnering with energy providers and governments worldwide to optimize clean energy systems. Their mission is to create a sustainable energy future by combining advanced technology with innovative thinking.




How to Apply

If you’re passionate about using data science to solve global energy challenges, we want to hear from you! Send your CV and a brief cover letter to dan.wotherspoon@intellectgroup.com
