  • Career Growth: Opportunities for professional development and leadership within the company.
  • Attractive Benefits: Flexible working hours, annual professional development budget, Hybrid working or remote (from Germany), and access to state-of-the-art facilities.
  • Ideal Location: Based in Hamburg, a city known for its leadership in renewable energy innovation and vibrant tech community.


About the Client

Our client is a trailblazer in the renewable energy industry, partnering with energy providers and governments worldwide to optimize clean energy systems. Their mission is to create a sustainable energy future by combining advanced technology with innovative thinking.


How to Apply

If you’re passionate about using data science to solve global energy challenges, we want to hear from you! Send your CV and a brief cover letter to dan.wotherspoon@intellectgroup.com

Title: Data Scientist - CDI
HTML:
ABOUT DESCARTES UNDERWRITING

Descartes was born out of the conviction that the ever-increasing complexity of risks faced by corporations, governments and vulnerable communities calls for a renewed approach in insurance. Our team brings together industry veterans from the most renowned institutions (AXA, SCOR, Swiss Re, Marsh, Aon, ...) and scientists on top of their field to bring underwriting excellence. After 5 years of existence, Descartes has secured a leading position in parametric insurance for weather and climate-related risks utilizing machine learning, real-time monitoring from satellite imagery & IoT. After a successful Series B raise of $120M USD, we launched Descartes Insurance, a 'full stack' insurer licensed to underwrite risk by the French regulator ACPR. With a growing corporate client base (400+ and counting), our diverse team is headquartered in Paris and operates out of our 17 global offices in North America, Europe, Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan. Descartes is trusted by a panel of A-rated (re)insurers to carry out its activities.



ABOUT YOUR ROLE

Due to rapid growth, at the core of our company’s strategy, we are seeking to expand our Data science team, either across our *Underwriting* or our *R&D* functions.


On the one hand, upstream, the R&D team aims at developing new and innovative models thanks to state-of-the-art research to help the Underwriting team meet with efficiency and reliability towards the clients.

On the other hand, the Underwriting team takes action subsequently in structuring and pricing of parametric insurance covers to deliver insurance products to a worldwide based public sector and corporate clients.


These roles will allow you to gain knowledge of the insurance industry and the emerging risks (natural catastrophes, cyber…), all while collaborating closely with other internal teams (Software, Operations, Legal and Commercial) and our external partners.


If you are interested in joining the Underwriting team, your key missions will include:

  • Conducting structuring work, risk analysis and insurance proposal for worldwide public sector and corporate clients;
  • Discussing business opportunities with Descartes’ partners and being responsible for technical documentation and insurance contracts redaction;
  • Collaborating with the business team to understand client needs and issues to further improve our product offering;
  • Participating in the development of Descartes’ technological platform to differentiate Descartes from its competitors (nat cat models and pricing tools);
  • Working autonomously and pragmatically to make appropriate technical decisions with attention to details.


If you are interested in joining the R&D team, your key missions will include:

  • Developing new models to improve our understanding of climate risks;
  • Conducting research and identifying new and innovative ideas on the modeling of climate risks and machine learning methods;
  • Testing state-of-the-art methods from scratch based on recent research articles;
  • Collaborating with the Underwriting, Business and Software teams to ensure our products are efficiently integrated into the underwriting process and meet our client’s needs;
  • Working autonomously and pragmatically to make appropriate technical decisions.



ABOUT YOU


QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS

As an Underwriting Data Scientist:

  • Graduated from an Engineering school with a specialization in computer science, applied mathematics, climate or meteorological studies;
  • Ideally a previous experience (long-term internship) in data science, insurance or climate modeling;
  • Proficient in statistics, probabilities, applied mathematics and machine learning methods;
  • Proficient in Python (e.g. pandas, scikit-learn);
  • Insurance or Cat modeling experience is a plus;
  • Excellent communication (written and verbal);
  • Fluency in English (written and verbal communication) is required;
  • Good command of one additional language (e.g. Chinese, French, Italian, German, Spanish…) is valued.


As a R&D Data Scientist:

  • Graduated from a research-oriented Master’s Degree or PhD in physics, applied mathematics, climate or meteorological studies;
  • Ideally a previous experience (long-term internship) in climate modeling or data science;
  • Proficient in statistics, probabilities, applied mathematics and machine learning methods;
  • Proficient in Python (e.g. pandas, scikit-learn);
  • Cat modeling experience is a plus;
  • Eye for quality and attention to detail;
  • Fluency in English (written and verbal communication) is required.


MINDSET

  • Eager to learn more on the insurance industry;
  • Interested in weather and natural perils modelling (wildfires, hail, tsunamis, earthquakes...);
  • Excellent team player with an entrepreneurial mindset;
  • Results oriented with the ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment;
  • Strong desire to learn and commitment to the organization’s mission.



WHY JOIN DESCARTES UNDERWRITING ?

  • Opportunity to work and learn with teams from the most prestigious schools and research labs in the world, allowing you to progress towards technical excellence;
  • Commitment from Descartes to its staff of continued learning and development (think annual seminars, training etc.);
  • Work in a collaborative & professional environment;
  • Be part of an international team, passionate about diversity;
  • Join a company with a true purpose – help us help our clients be more resilient towards climate risks;
  • A competitive salary, bonus and benefits;
  • You can benefit from a punctual home office days.


At Descartes Underwriting, we cherish value of diversity whatever it may be. We are committed to fighting against all forms of discrimination and for equal opportunities. We foster an inclusive work environment that respects all differences.

With equal skills, all our positions are open to people with disabilities.


RECRUITMENT PROCESS

  • Step 1: HR Interview with our Talent Recruiter
  • Step 2: Technical online test (via Github)
  • Step 3: Remote technical interview
  • Step 4: Remote manager interview (occurred before the technical test possibly)
  • Step 5: In person team interview to meet our team and discover our offices (held remotely if you are abroad)

Title: Gen AI Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
¡Bienvenido al lugar que te mereces!




🔍¿Qué buscamos?







Buscamos un/una Machine Learning Engineer con al menos dos años de experiencia para trabajar en el equipo de AIF Engineering empleando GenAI.




Te buscamos, independientemente de tu género, capacidades diferentes, orientación sexual, origen étnico o cualquier característica que te haga único/a.




✨Qué esperamos de ti✨




Formación y experiencia

● Titulación en informática, telecomunicaciones, ingeniería

● Conocimientos de arquitectura de aplicaciones y computación distribuida

● Conocimientos sobre arquitecturas y modelos LLM

● Lenguajes (experiencia mínima en alguno de ellos de 2 años): Python, Scala, Spark

● Conocimientos de Integración continua: DevOps: GIT, Jenkins

● Conocimientos de Shell Script, Linux y SO

● Conocimientos en seguridad de aplicaciones

● Conocimientos de desarrollo y gestión de microservicios

● Conocimientos y deseable certificación en cloud pública (AWS)

● Conocimientos en plataformas Hadoop y sistemas de ficheros distribuidos

● Conocimientos de SQL




Competencias

● Alta capacidad para aprender nuevas tecnologías referentes a plataforma, nube,

arquitectura y seguridad

● Capacidad de trabajar en entornos de cambio e innovación y de adaptación a las necesidades de los proyectos

● Proactividad en la propuesta de soluciones y colaboraciones

● Capacidad de análisis y abstracción, comunicación, responsabilidad, compromiso, compañerismo y trabajo en equipo

● Experiencia en metodologías de trabajo ágiles




😎 Qué responsabilidades tendrás:




En una primera fase de diseño, colaboración con diferentes equipos en tareas de:

Participación en el diseño de la solución, escalado de necesidades y capacidades técnicas necesarias y documentar los diseños de la solución a bajo nivel




En la fase de desarrollo del dato:

Aplicación de las mejores prácticas de ingeniería del software a los proyectos
realizados
Implementación e industrialización de toda la capa de gestión de agentes
(infraestructura, RAG, etc...).
Participar en el ciclo de vida del producto junto con otros roles
Realizar las pruebas pertinentes generando métricas de calidad medibles
Aportar mejoras en el reliability y rendimiento de las soluciones.
Integrar los productos desarrollados dentro del ecosistema bancario
Generando la documentación técnica necesaria para la correcta ejecución del proyecto




Finalmente, durante la fase de implantación:

Validar los niveles de calidad generados en el desarrollo en curso
Desplegar los desarrollos en los diferentes entornos corporativos
Monitorizar el comportamiento técnico de los mismos
Operar los desarrollos aplicativos en los entornos corporativos
Realizar un mantenimiento evolutivo y correctivo de los desarrollos realizados







💙Qué tenemos de especial




2000€ anuales para seguir formándote dentro de tu horario laboral y alimentar esa curiosidad infinita que tanto nos gusta!! Tenemos un modelo de formación que te aseguramos que te va a gustar y mucho.
Creemos en tu desarrollo profesional. Lo cuidamos con un modelo de talento donde podrás evolucionar a través de la experiencia, logros y habilidades que irás adquiriendo dentro de Next.
Contrato indefinido en una compañía 100% digital, tecnológica y en un grupo financiero líder internacional.
¡30 días de vacaciones al año! Jornada intensiva los viernes y dos meses de verano.
Un modelo de teletrabajo perfecto para la conciliación y disfrute de tu tiempo libre, por eso ofrecemos un modelo híbrido porque el trabajo en remoto nos gusta y mucho. Además, tenemos horario flexible de entrada y salida para que seas tú quien decida cómo organizar tu tiempo.
Ayudas para familiares con discapacidad gracias a nuestro Programa Plan Familia de la Fundación Adecco.
Tendrás ayuda alimentaria y ayuda a gastos de teletrabajo.
Dispondrás de un sistema de retribución flexible (transporte, seguro médico de Sanitas, Movistar...).
Ser una compañía 100% BBVA tiene sus ventajas como poder disfrutar de todos los productos financieros con condiciones especiales para empleados del Grupo (hipotecas, préstamos, tarjetas, seguros, etc.).
¿Te preguntas si tendrás visibilidad? Sí. Favorecemos que puedas asistir a eventos tanto nacionales como internacionales, así como a organizar los tuyos propios open company. Podrás participar en las iniciativas y actividades de la compañía. Y por supuesto, nuestras redes sociales están a disposición de todo el mundo para mostrar lo que vales.




Entonces… ¿Qué nos dices? ¿Hacemos match? 😉

Title: AI Senior Data Scientist
HTML:
Siamo il Gruppo Lottomatica, leader nel settore del gioco regolamentato in Italia e uno dei maggiori operatori europei, in tutte le aree di attività: scommesse sportive, gioco online e macchine da intrattenimento. Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualità, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilità e la sostenibilità al centro del business. Essere in Lottomatica è molto più che far parte di un'azienda: significa contribuire a un progetto imprenditoriale grande e responsabile.


Siamo alla ricerca di un profilo di AI Senior Data Scientist che entrerà a far parte del Dipartimento Operations & Technology del nostro Gruppo.


Requisiti:

  • Laurea o diploma in ambito scientifico/informatico/statistico o comprovata esperienza nell’elaborazione di dati e nell’applicazione di modelli statistici/matematici/Machine Learning.
  • Conoscenza approfondita di algoritmi di Machine Learning e AI (LLM, modelli ad albero, NLP, clustering, neural network, time series, etc).
  • Conoscenza dei meccanicismi di analisi e preprocessing dei dati e feature engineering per progetti di Machine Learning (streaming e batch).
  • Capacità di coding e debugging in Pyspark e Python e quindi conoscenza delle principali librerie e frameworks di Machine Learning, soprattutto Spark e MLib, poi MLflow, Dataframe, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn…
  • Competenze in modellazione dati, modellazione di esperimenti statistici e conoscenza metodi quantitativi in generale.
  • Esperienza comprovata nel progettare, implementare e industrializzare soluzioni AI integrate.
  • Capacità di analisi di problemi di business, dati e contesto. Capacità di effettuare test delle ipotesi, comparazione di modelli, interpretazione e validazione dei risultati.
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Principali attività:

  • Disegnare, progettare, implementare e documentare nuove soluzioni AI a supporto dei processi aziendali;
  • Contribuire allo sviluppo e all’evoluzione della Data Platform in relazione ad aspetti tecnologici, organizzativi e di processo;
  • Contribuire alla crescita del patrimonio dati aziendale;
  • Collaborare con gli altri membri del team al fine di promuovere una cultura organizzativa di gruppo improntata su principi di solidarietà, pragmaticità, efficacia e affiatamento;
  • Manutenzione, sviluppo ed evoluzione dei modelli attualmente in produzione, assumendone la gestione completa in collaborazione con il team;
  • Progettazione, implementazione, industrializzazione, manutenzione e monitoraggio di pipeline di machine learning e agenti virtuali in grado di supportare la trasformazione dei processi aziendali;
  • Relazione diretta col cliente interno per la valutazione dei risultati e la raccolta dei requisiti evolutivi.


Sarà considerato un plus:

  • Conoscenza Databricks;
  • Git per il versioning del codice e rudimenti di devops;
  • Conoscenza servizi Azure;
  • Conoscenza Power BI;
  • Esperienza nell’utilizzo degli LLM open.


Cosa troverai in Lottomatica:

  • Opportunità di lavorare nella più grande azienda di scommesse e giochi in Italia e una delle più grandi al mondo;
  • Lavorare in un ambiente molto dinamico e migliorare le proprie competenze acquisendone di nuove;
  • Essere sfidati a fornire soluzioni d'impatto per grandi organizzazioni e avere un impatto diretto sui loro dipendenti;
  • Possibilità di partecipare a progetti di beneficenza, legalità e responsabilità attraverso l'impegno in Fondazione Lottomatica;
  • Un modello di DNA aziendale definito in cui Inclusione, Valore della Diversità, Eccellenza e Collaborazione sono i pilastri;
  • Far parte dell'azienda numero uno al mondo nel settore per impegno ESG;
  • Eccellenti opportunità di crescita.


Cosa offriamo:

  • Contratto a tempo indeterminato e opportunità di lavoro ibrido;
  • Laptop aziendale;
  • Formazione continua su hard skills e soft skills;
  • Stipendio annuo lordo commisurato all'esperienza (da 35k a 40k)



Lottomatica attua una politica che garantisce pari opportunità e promuove diversità e inclusione, contro ogni forma di discriminazione.

In Lottomatica crediamo che ogni persona sia unica e consideriamo la diversity come una fonte di arricchimento personale e organizzativo.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno affinché il nostro sia un ambiente aperto, sicuro e inclusivo, dove ogni persona possa essere pienamente se stessa indipendentemente da genere, religione, sesso, età, etnia, nazionalità, disabilità, stato civile o orientamento sessuale.



******

We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.


We are looking for an AI Senior Data Scientist to join the Operations & Technology Department of our Group.


Requirements:

  • Degree or diploma in a scientific/computer/statistical field or proven experience in data processing and the application of statistical/mathematical/Machine Learning models.
  • In-depth knowledge of Machine Learning and AI algorithms (e.g., LLMs, tree-based models, NLP, clustering, neural networks, time series, etc.).
  • Expertise in data analysis, preprocessing, and feature engineering for Machine Learning projects (streaming and batch).
  • Proficiency in coding and debugging in PySpark and Python, including knowledge of key Machine Learning libraries and frameworks, especially:
  • Spark MLlib, MLflow, Dataframe, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn.
  • Skills in data modeling, statistical experiment design, and general quantitative methods.
  • Proven experience in designing, implementing, and industrializing integrated AI solutions.
  • Strong analytical skills to address business problems, data, and context. Ability to test hypotheses, compare models, interpret, and validate results.
  • Good knowledge of the English language.


Responsabilities:

  • Design, develop, implement, and document new AI solutions to support business processes.
  • Contribute to the development and evolution of the Data Platform, focusing on technological, organizational, and procedural aspects.
  • Enhance the company’s data assets.
  • Collaborate with other team members to promote an organizational culture based on principles of solidarity, pragmatism, effectiveness, and teamwork.
  • Maintain, develop, and evolve existing models in production, taking full responsibility for their management in collaboration with the team.
  • Design, implement, industrialize, maintain, and monitor machine learning pipelines and virtual agents to support the transformation of business processes.
  • Work directly with internal clients to evaluate results and gather evolving requirements.



Preferred qualifications:

  • Knowledge of Databricks.
  • Familiarity with Git for version control and basic DevOps concepts.
  • Experience with Azure services.
  • Knowledge of Power BI.
  • Hands-on experience with open LLMs.


What you will find in Lottomatica:

  • Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world;
  • Work in a dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones;
  • Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees;
  • Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica;
  • A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars;
  • Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment;
  • Excellent growth opportunities.


What we offer:

  • Permanent contract and hybrid work opportunities.
  • Company laptop.
  • Continuous training on hard and soft skills.
  • Annual gross salary commensurate with experience (€35k - €40k).



Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination. At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment. We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data and analytics, and eager to drive business value through actionable insights? Do you thrive in dynamic environments and love turning complex data into clear, impactful solutions?




We’re looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join the team in Copenhagen for a 12 month period. You will play a pivotal role in our Customer Insights initiatives, helping us understand customer behaviors and enhance decision-making across the organization.




Would you like to…




Lead and steer data tracks of projects, conducting exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover trends and insights within large datasets
Develop and maintain AI-driven codebases, including predictive models, classification algorithms, and clustering techniques
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate AI and data science solutions into business operations
Provide BI expertise by creating and maintaining dashboards using tools like PowerBI
Translate complex data findings into clear, concise, and actionable insights for stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Develop and implement data models to support business intelligence and reporting initiatives




We would like you to be…




Highly proficient in SQL and PySpark, with experience in data modeling for business intelligence
Experienced in traditional Machine Learning projects, including predictive modeling, classification, and clustering
Skilled in Python for data analytics, with the ability to implement and optimize models
Hands-on with Databricks or Dremio for large-scale data processing and analysis
Strong in data visualization, particularly with PowerBI or similar dashboarding tools
Familiar with Natural Language Processing (NLP) concepts and their application in customer insights (a plus)




Would you like to join…




A team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning
An environment where your insights directly impact business decisions and customer satisfaction
A culture that encourages innovation and the sharing of ideas




Please note Designit can only consider applicants with the right to work in Denmark.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Winning Consulting, we are on the lookout for aData Scientistto be part of our dynamic team. This role involves working on an exciting project for one of our key clients in the baking sector based in Lisbon. Hybrid model.

Responsabilities:


Run python- based analyst engines (direct marketing, inbound marketing, web navigation) on a regular basis
Collect data and investigate their business value through data analysis
Create and adpat models and tools
Develop and improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Ensure high quality of delivery
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our models
Create/Update some dashboard


Skills:


Experience in Python
Fluency in English is mandatory


Quem Somos?

A Winning Consulting é uma empresa de consultoria que oferece serviços de

consultadoria, formação, recrutamento e investigação. Apoiamos os nossos clientes na

procura de soluções inovadoras e sustentáveis, desde a aplicação do conhecimento

científico na resolução de problemas complexos de gestão até à transformação digital

e tecnológica das organizações.

Se quiser saber mais sobre nós, visite o nosso websitehttps://www.winning.consulting.com/

Todas as candidaturas são tratadas com confidencialidade ao abrigo do RGPD. Ao subscreveres a tua candidatura, concordas com o

tratamento da tua informação no âmbito do recrutamento e na tua inclusão na nossa base de dados de candidatos. Caso não dês

consentimento para o tratamento destes dados, pedimos-te o favor de não te candidatares a este anúncio.

At Winning Consulting, we are on the lookout for aData Scientistto be part of our dynamic team. This role involves working on an exciting project for one of our key clients in the baking sector based in Lisbon. Hybrid model.

Responsabilities:

  • Run python- based analyst engines (direct marketing, inbound marketing, web navigation) on a regular basis
  • Collect data and investigate their business value through data analysis
  • Create and adpat models and tools
  • Develop and improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
  • Ensure high quality of delivery
  • Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our models
  • Create/Update some dashboard

Skills:

  • Experience in Python
  • Fluency in English is mandatory

Quem Somos?

A Winning Consulting é uma empresa de consultoria que oferece serviços de

e tecnológica das organizações.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
Excellence è un gruppo multi-boutique formato da più società con diversa specializzazione: dalla Consulenza Strategica, al ridisegno dei modelli operativi, e al Change Management, fino a coprire temi più innovativi come la Digital Disruption oppure la transizione dei modelli di business in chiave ESG.

Il Gruppo è stato fondato nel 2007 e rappresenta uno dei più significativi casi di successo di start-up che in breve tempo è riuscita a crescere ed affermarsi nel settore dei professional services.




Dataskills opera a 360° nel settore della Data Science, aiutando ad estrarre valore dal patrimonio di dati aziendale. Leader italiano in questo campo, ricerca e sviluppa negli ambiti di Business Intelligence, Big Data Analytics, Analisi Predittiva, Artificial Intelligence, e IOT e collabora con le principali aziende dell’industria 4.0.




Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa brillante da inserire nel ruolo di: DATA SCIENTIST




Cosa farai?

Svilupperai soluzioni avanzate di Predictive Analytics ed AI Generativa progettando modelli di Machine Learning e architetture AI per supportare le decisioni strategiche aziendali;
Riceverai supporto e formazione da esperti del settore per affinare costantemente le tue competenze;
Lavorerai su progetti sfidanti che richiederanno l'applicazione di tecniche di data science all'avanguardia;
Prenderai parte allo sviluppo delle competenze interne all’area DataSkills e contribuirai alla crescita dell’azienda portando idee, spunti individuali e proposte di nuovi progetti e prodotti, seguendone lo sviluppo verso i clienti.




Chi ricerchiamo?

Esperienza di almeno 1 anno in ruoli relativi a Data Analytics, Machine Learning o GenAI;
Passione per i dati e abilità nell’analisi di informazioni complesse;
Capacità di presentazione, comunicazione e sintesi di informazioni tecniche;
Padronanza consolidata di Python, utilizzato come principale strumento di analisi e sviluppo di modelli predittivi;
Solida competenza in SQL, con abilità nel progettare query.
Conoscenza di algoritmi, modelli e principali tecniche di Machine Learning
Ottime doti relazionali, capacità organizzative, proattività ed entusiasmo;
Capacità di leadership, capacità relazionale e predisposizione al lavoro di gruppo;
Conoscenza della lingua inglese al livello B2 o superiore (Riferimento: Common European Framework of Reference for Languages);
Conoscenza della lingua italiana al livello C1 o superiore (Riferimento: CEFR Common European Framework of Reference for Languages).




Gradita, ma non essenziale:

Esperienza nella costruzione di Data Warehouse/Data Lake
Esperienza con Apache Spark ed Azure Databricks




Perché Gruppo Excellence?

Farai parte della nostra crescita

Sarai coinvolto/a in progetti strategici e innovativi per lo sviluppo del business aziendale e potrai lavorare direttamente con il Top Management delle aziende cliente. Chi entrerà a fare parte della nostra squadra troverà un ambiente di lavoro giovane, smart, proattivo e stimolante e avrà la possibilità di lavorare nell’ambito di progetti dinamici per aziende leader nei mercati di riferimento.

Svilupperai il tuo potenziale

Avrai accesso alla nostra piattaforma di formazione Excellence Academy, con un catalogo sempre aggiornato di corsi su hard e soft skills che accresceranno le tue competenze su numerose tematiche. Premiamo il merito e il talento, anche attraverso un percorso di carriera personalizzato: ti daremo la possibilità di realizzare aspirazioni personali in linea con gli obiettivi aziendali.

Siamo un’organizzazione orizzontale in cui la voce di ciascuno viene accolta e valorizzata!

Ci impegniamo a promuovere e a tutelare il valore delle nostre persone, necessarie e fondamentali per lo sviluppo del knowledge aziendale.

Avrai un ottimo work-life balance

Troverai una policy che supporta il lavoro flessibile e la possibilità di lavorare da casa quando necessario. Ti riserviamo un piano welfare per acquisto abbonamenti mezzi pubblici, buoni spesa, corsi, ingressi cinema, abbonamenti palestre, viaggi e molto altro.

Lavorerai in un ambiente inclusivo ed equo

Valorizziamo la diversità, l’unicità e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutte le nostre persone abbiano pari opportunità lavorative. Il nostro processo di selezione è meritocratico e lontano da qualsivoglia forma di discriminazione diretta o indiretta, nel rispetto dei migliori standard internazionali e delle leggi applicabili (inclusi ma non limitati alla L. 903/77).

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Luxembourg-based)
Description:
We're looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with research experience to join our AI team. You'll bridge the gap between research and engineering, implementing and deploying state-of-the-art NLP solutions while maintaining high engineering standards.

Important: This position is based in our Luxembourg office.

Tasks


Implement and adapt latest research in NLP for production use
Develop and deploy efficient RAG systems and fine-tuning pipelines
Design and conduct experiments to validate new approaches
Build and maintain ML pipelines and data processing workflows
Contribute to MLOps practices and infrastructure improvements



Requirements

Required Qualifications:


Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field
3+ years of hands-on ML engineering experience
Demonstrated research experience (publications, research projects, or industrial research)
Strong programming skills in Python and ML frameworks (PyTorch, JAX)
Experience with latest transformer based architectures
Knowledge of ML deployment and MLOps tools (Docker, MLflow, W&B, DVC)



Nice to Have:


Computer vision experience
ASR experience
Reinforcement learning experience
Experience with multi-modal models
Knowledge of distributed training systems
Open-source contributions
Experience in a startup-like environment
German proficiency is a plus



Benefits


Attractive compensation aligned with your skills
Dynamic workspace in the heart of Luxembourg
Flexible work arrangements
Professional development allowance

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Opportunity: Junior to Mid-Level Data Scientist – Join a Science-Driven Innovator in Darmstadt, Germany




Salary: €50,000 - €70,000 per year (depending on experience)




Are you a data enthusiast eager to apply your skills in a science-driven environment? I’m working with an exciting client based in Darmstadt, a city renowned for its scientific innovation, to find a talented Data Scientist. This forward-thinking company operates at the intersection of data science, research, and cutting-edge technology.




Specializing in supporting scientific industries such as biotechnology, pharmaceuticals, and space exploration, this company leverages big data and AI to solve complex challenges. Their work includes developing predictive models for drug discovery, optimizing manufacturing processes for biotech companies, and enhancing data analytics for space missions. With a commitment to innovation, they are shaping the future of science through the power of data.




About the Role:

As a Data Scientist, you’ll play a key role in transforming raw data into actionable insights, helping drive breakthrough advancements in science and technology. You’ll work alongside experts in AI, engineering, and scientific research to deliver solutions that directly impact industries and global initiatives.




What You’ll Do:

Analyze and interpret complex scientific datasets to uncover trends and inform decision-making.
Develop and implement machine learning models to support projects in drug discovery, materials science, and space technology.
Collaborate with cross-disciplinary teams of scientists, engineers, and industry experts.
Design and maintain robust data pipelines for handling large-scale, high-dimensional datasets.
Present insights and recommendations to stakeholders in clear, actionable formats.
Stay updated on the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and scientific research.




What We’re Looking For:

A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field (candidates with strong scientific backgrounds are highly encouraged to apply).
1-3 years of experience in a data science or analytics role (open to fresh graduates with exceptional academic or project experience).
Strong programming skills in Python or R, with experience in data libraries like Pandas, NumPy, or Scikit-learn.
Familiarity with SQL for data querying and managing relational databases.
A solid understanding of statistics, machine learning techniques, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Matplotlib, Power BI).
A passion for science and technology, with a curious and problem-solving mindset.
Bonus: Experience with big data tools (e.g., Spark) or cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).




Why Join?

Competitive Salary: €50,000 - €70,000 per year, depending on your experience and expertise.
Scientific Impact: Contribute to groundbreaking projects in biotechnology, pharmaceuticals, and space exploration.
Learning Opportunities: Access to professional development programs, workshops, and mentorship.
Innovative Work Environment: Collaborate with some of the brightest minds in science and data.
Flexibility: Hybrid working options, supporting a healthy work-life balance.
Prime Location: Be part of Darmstadt’s thriving scientific community, surrounded by world-class research institutions and innovation hubs.




This role offers a unique opportunity to combine your passion for data science with meaningful contributions to the world of scientific research and innovation.




📩 Apply today or reach out to me directly at dan.wotherspoon@intellectgroup.com to learn more about this exciting opportunity!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
En Rovimática, somos pioneros en el desarrollo de tecnologías avanzadas en los campos de la robótica, la inteligencia artificial y la automatización. Nuestro enfoque principal es diseñar y proveer soluciones tecnológicas innovadoras que abordan los desafíos más significativos de la sociedad. Participamos activamente en proyectos de investigación tanto a nivel nacional como europeo, liderando el camino hacia avances tecnológicos disruptivos.

Actualmente, buscamos a un/a Data Scientist para unirse a nuestro departamento de I+D+i, donde tendrá la oportunidad de contribuir directamente a nuestra misión de transformar y mejorar el entorno a través de las últimas tecnologías.




Responsabilidades:

Identificar desafíos dentro del negocio y formularlos como problemas matemáticos específicos para soluciones de análisis avanzado.
Aplicar técnicas de álgebra lineal, cálculo y estadísticas avanzadas para desarrollar modelos predictivos y algoritmos de machine learning.
Experimentar con AI y técnicas de machine learning/deep learning para explorar nuevos enfoques y mejorar la precisión de los modelos.




Requisitos esenciales:

Experiencia mínima de dos años en ciencia de datos o un campo relacionado.
Conocimientos profundos en álgebra lineal, cálculo diferencial e integral, y estadísticas aplicadas.
Competencia en el manejo de herramientas de ciencia de datos.
Capacidad para manejar, visualizar e interpretar grandes conjuntos de datos.




Requisitos deseables:

Fuerte dominio de Python y/o R, con habilidades probadas en programación efectiva.
Experiencia en NLP, consultas SQL avanzadas y principios fundamentales de gestión y almacenamiento de datos.
Título en Matemáticas, Estadística o un campo relacionado; se valorarán másters o cursos avanzados en estas áreas.
Experiencia en varios sistemas de gestión de bases de datos (RDBMS).




Ofrecemos:

Oportunidad de trabajar en un entorno estimulante con proyectos que desafían y expanden tus habilidades.
Cultura de colaboración y innovación con un equipo dedicado a la excelencia tecnológica.
Modalidad de trabajo híbrido con posibilidad de incorporación en nuestras oficinas de Sevilla (Aerópolis) o Córdoba.
Paquete competitivo de beneficios y posibilidades de crecimiento profesional.




Si eres una persona apasionada por los datos y posees enfoque analítico para resolver problemas complejos mediante técnicas matemáticas avanzadas, ¡te invitamos a aplicar para unirte a nuestro equipo en Rovimática!

Title: Data Scientist - AI Agents & Generative AI (f/m/d)*
Description:
Your Mission

As a Data Scientist (f/m/d)*, you will evaluate and improve the performance of our AI Agents. This will involve developing evaluation tasks for agent behaviour, fine-tuning foundation models, researching and prototyping new AI Agent features and frameworks, and investigating issues affecting our customers. You’ll develop a deep understanding of the behaviour of our models and AI Agents. You’ll work directly with product engineering and sales teams, leading by example on evaluating and improving our product - from testing new AI system optimisation frameworks to fine-tuning STT models on new languages and accents.

You’ll join the AI & Data Science Team, a collaborative group of Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientists that own Parloa’s ML Evaluation Platform and the machine learning models that power our product. The team is responsible for keeping Parloa at the forefront of research and development of Generative AI and AI Agent based products.

In This Role You Will


Take ownership of data science and machine learning projects that help us improve our generative AI product suite
Develop and evaluate production Agentic AI systems for real customer use cases
Directly support and collaborate with product engineering and sales, analyzing the performance of our AI products and prototyping new features
Evaluate and train or fine-tune a variety of models, including LLMs, intent classification, STT, and TTS models
Execute Machine Learning research and development projects end-to-end, rapidly turning new ideas into customer facing features


Our Tech stack (AI & Data): Python, OpenAI, LangGraph, SQL, Microsoft Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, Eventhubs (Kafka), PostHog, Databricks, DeltaLiveTables, Preset

What You Bring To The Table


3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist
Experience developing and owning production ML models and systems. Experience with LLMs, NLP, or information retrieval is a strong plus
Proficiency in Python and experience with using using Python in production
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark) and using ML Ops platforms (e.g. MLFlow)
Experience in leading small-sized technical projects (1-2 months roadmap)
Strong spoken and written communication skills in English


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?


Be part of a dynamic, driven team of +40 nationalities with flat hierarchies and a collaborative company culture
Flexible office policy - we believe in hiring the best talent, no matter where they are based. However, we love to build real connections and want to welcome everyone in the office
Attractive compensation package
Training and development budget which can be used for conferences and attending development courses to ensure continuous professional growth
Flexible working hours, 28 vacation days and workation opportunities
Enjoy unlimited access to a variety of fitness, yoga, and leisure activities via Wellpass or Urban Sport Club.
We cover the cost of a monthly Deutschland train ticket.
Leverage exclusive offers with our corporate benefits portal, giving you access to compelling deals from leading brands.
Regular team events, game nights, and other social activities
And last but not least: a beautiful office with flair in the heart of Berlin with all the conveniences, such as adjustable desks, social area, fresh fruits, cereals and drinks
Is something missing here? Reach out and let's talk about what else you need for your ideal next growth opportunity


Your Recruiting Process At Parloa

Recruiter video call → Hiring Manager Interview → Technical Stage 1 (Data Science Coding Session) → Technical Stage 2 (Machine Learning Theory & Case Study) → Meeting the team

Why Parloa?

Parloa is one of the fastest growing startups in the world of Generative AI and customer service. Parloa’s voice-first GenAI platform for contact centers is built on the best AI technology to automate customer service with natural-sounding conversations for outstanding experiences on all communication channels. Leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning, Parloa creates intelligent phone and chat solutions for businesses that turn contact centers into value centers by boosting customer service efficiency. The Parloa platform resolves the majority of customer queries quickly and automatically, allowing human agents to focus on complex issues and relationships. Parloa was founded in 2018 by Malte Kosub and Stefan Ostwald and today employs over 250 people in Berlin, Munich, and New York.

When you join Parloa, you become part of a dynamic and innovative team made up of over 34 nationalities that’s revolutionizing an entire industry. We’re passionate about growing together and creating opportunities for personal and professional development. With our recent $66 million Series B investment, we’re expanding globally and looking for talented individuals to join us on this exciting journey.

Do you have questions about Parloa, the role, or our team before you apply? Please feel free to get in touch with our Hiring Team.

Parloa is committed to upholding the highest data protection standards for our clients' and employees' data. All our employees are instrumental in ensuring the utmost care, GDPR, and ISO compliance, including ISO 27001, in handling sensitive information.


We provide equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless race, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, national origin, disability status, socioeconomic background and other characteristics.
Show more
HTML:
Your Mission

As a Data Scientist (f/m/d)*, you will evaluate and improve the performance of our AI Agents. This will involve developing evaluation tasks for agent behaviour, fine-tuning foundation models, researching and prototyping new AI Agent features and frameworks, and investigating issues affecting our customers. You’ll develop a deep understanding of the behaviour of our models and AI Agents. You’ll work directly with product engineering and sales teams, leading by example on evaluating and improving our product - from testing new AI system optimisation frameworks to fine-tuning STT models on new languages and accents.

You’ll join the AI & Data Science Team, a collaborative group of Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientists that own Parloa’s ML Evaluation Platform and the machine learning models that power our product. The team is responsible for keeping Parloa at the forefront of research and development of Generative AI and AI Agent based products.

In This Role You Will

  • Take ownership of data science and machine learning projects that help us improve our generative AI product suite
  • Develop and evaluate production Agentic AI systems for real customer use cases
  • Directly support and collaborate with product engineering and sales, analyzing the performance of our AI products and prototyping new features
  • Evaluate and train or fine-tune a variety of models, including LLMs, intent classification, STT, and TTS models
  • Execute Machine Learning research and development projects end-to-end, rapidly turning new ideas into customer facing features

Our Tech stack (AI & Data): Python, OpenAI, LangGraph, SQL, Microsoft Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, Eventhubs (Kafka), PostHog, Databricks, DeltaLiveTables, Preset

What You Bring To The Table

  • 3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist
  • Experience developing and owning production ML models and systems. Experience with LLMs, NLP, or information retrieval is a strong plus
  • Proficiency in Python and experience with using using Python in production
  • Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark) and using ML Ops platforms (e.g. MLFlow)
  • Experience in leading small-sized technical projects (1-2 months roadmap)
  • Strong spoken and written communication skills in English

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Be part of a dynamic, driven team of +40 nationalities with flat hierarchies and a collaborative company culture
  • Flexible office policy - we believe in hiring the best talent, no matter where they are based. However, we love to build real connections and want to welcome everyone in the office
  • Attractive compensation package
  • Training and development budget which can be used for conferences and attending development courses to ensure continuous professional growth
  • Flexible working hours, 28 vacation days and workation opportunities
  • Enjoy unlimited access to a variety of fitness, yoga, and leisure activities via Wellpass or Urban Sport Club.
  • We cover the cost of a monthly Deutschland train ticket.
  • Leverage exclusive offers with our corporate benefits portal, giving you access to compelling deals from leading brands.
  • Regular team events, game nights, and other social activities
  • And last but not least: a beautiful office with flair in the heart of Berlin with all the conveniences, such as adjustable desks, social area, fresh fruits, cereals and drinks
  • Is something missing here? Reach out and let's talk about what else you need for your ideal next growth opportunity

Your Recruiting Process At Parloa

Recruiter video call → Hiring Manager Interview → Technical Stage 1 (Data Science Coding Session) → Technical Stage 2 (Machine Learning Theory & Case Study) → Meeting the team

Why Parloa?

Parloa is one of the fastest growing startups in the world of Generative AI and customer service. Parloa’s voice-first GenAI platform for contact centers is built on the best AI technology to automate customer service with natural-sounding conversations for outstanding experiences on all communication channels. Leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning, Parloa creates intelligent phone and chat solutions for businesses that turn contact centers into value centers by boosting customer service efficiency. The Parloa platform resolves the majority of customer queries quickly and automatically, allowing human agents to focus on complex issues and relationships. Parloa was founded in 2018 by Malte Kosub and Stefan Ostwald and today employs over 250 people in Berlin, Munich, and New York.

When you join Parloa, you become part of a dynamic and innovative team made up of over 34 nationalities that’s revolutionizing an entire industry. We’re passionate about growing together and creating opportunities for personal and professional development. With our recent $66 million Series B investment, we’re expanding globally and looking for talented individuals to join us on this exciting journey.

Do you have questions about Parloa, the role, or our team before you apply? Please feel free to get in touch with our Hiring Team.

Description:

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Overview:

In FRISS, we enable insurers worldwide to automatically detect potential insurance fraud. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance. Are you ready for an adventure? We are on the hunt for a Machine Learning Engineer!







Position Overview:

This role offers the flexibility to work from our vibrant office in Utrecht, Netherlands, or remotely from home. As part of our collaborative team, you will have the opportunity to share knowledge and work alongside other AI practitioners.







Key Responsibilities:

Implement scalable and efficient Machine Learning (ML) models.
Contribute to our in-house code libraries following good software development principles and practices.
Deploy our ML models in the cloud and monitor their performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into products.







Requirements:

Great understanding of and experience in building ML (and deep learning) models.
Excellent programming skills in Python; knowledge in SQL and Py/Spark is a plus.
Hands-on experience with MLOps; CI/CD pipelines, model deployment and monitoring.
Prior work using ML frameworks such as PyTorch (or Keras), Scikit-learn, pandas.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication skills in English.







Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge in Large Language Models (LLMs), efficient ML (quantization, distillation etc.) and transfer learning and fine-tuning.
Experience with Azure Services including Azure Datalake/Datahouse and Azure Databricks.
Experience with Rest API.
Familiarity with containerized (Docker) applications and Kubernetes.







What We Offer:

A stimulating and innovative work environment.
Flexible working options: 50/50 work from our Utrecht office or home.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative team culture where knowledge sharing is encouraged.







Apply Now:

If you are ready to play a crucial role at FRISS, we want to hear from you! Apply now via recruitment@friss.com to become our ML Engineer at FRISS and make a meaningful impact on our success.




Please note; We are only accepting applications from candidates based in the Netherlands.







About FRISS:

FRISS is a leading provider in fraud detection and risk mitigation solutions for the insurance industry. Founded in 2006, FRISS holds its head office in Utrecht, The Netherlands, with a global presence and global workforce, including Europe, the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance.

To learn more about FRISS, have a look at www.friss.com.

FRISS is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage you to be yourself. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, religious affiliation, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, nationality, or veteran status.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
WHO?

Thinking outside the box, growing beyond oneself and constantly pushing the boundaries. This is what ROGON Technologies and its employees live and exemplify every day. As a subsidiary of one of the largest market players in the football industry, we want to set an example with our technical innovations and make great things possible for the sport and its talents.

WHAT?

Make the unseen seen - With the CUJU App, we are digitalizing access to football for every talent in the world, regardless of gender, ethnicity or social status, enabling accessible and fully data-driven performance assessment. In an emotional, modern and dynamic environment, we are growing just as fast, building on an ever-expanding global community of talent, clubs and federations.

HOW?

Our employees grow in a culture that is characterized by expert knowledge, team spirit and innovation. All of this is supported by an international team that is not tied to a specific location, with flexible working hours and flat hierarchies, and works every day to bring football back to where it is invented every day: to the fans and talents around the world.

Tasks

Your tasks will consist of supporting the AI Team in operations as well as in the development, training, and maintenance of our state of the art sports analytics machine learning models and software. You will be also responsible for monitoring and maintaining the infrastructure and software. Moreover, you will support the team in the advancement of relevant IT infrastructure and work closely with other teams.

Requirements

ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS


Masters in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or other related fields with a quantitative focus
2+ years of experience in programming, preferably Python
Experience working with Linux systems and CLI
Knowledge of version control systems (BitBucket, GitLab, etc.)
First experience in Machine Learning and Deep Learning
Professional fluency in English
Good communication and presentation skills
Basic experience in SQL



GOOD TO HAVE


Exposure to ML applications in Computer Vision (keypoint detection, object tracking)
Elementary knowledge of cloud technologies, specifically AWS
Experience in sport analytics projects
please note: EU work permit is required
we would prefer the candidate to live in Germany or to move to Germany



Benefits


competitive salary
fully remote
relaxed and trustful working atmosphere in an experienced team
flexible working hours
flat hierarchies



Have you recognized yourself in all of this?

Then we look forward to receiving your application (all application documents in one document, PDF file, max. 10MB). Please note that we will only consider applications in electronic form.

Title: Junior Data Scientist | MCAST Apprenticeship
Description:
Position: Junior Data Scientist

Number of students: 1




About Us:

Altenar is an international IT company founded in 2011, with offices in Malta, Greece, Georgia, the Isle of Man, and Uruguay. We specialize in high-load software development and provide one of the best technology solutions for the iGaming industry worldwide.




Job Description:

As a Data Science Apprentice, you will play an active role in data mining, analysis, and the development of predictive models. This role is ideal for candidates with a basic knowledge of Python who are eager to further their skills and gain practical experience in a professional environment.




Key Responsibilities:

• Analyze extensive transactional databases to identify patterns in customer behavior

• Assist in designing, coding, and testing new data science features

• Collaborate with the Data Science team to better understand our customer base and provide valuable insights




What You'll Learn:

• Advanced Python programming including object oriented programming, and use of advanced data wrangling libraries

• Operating and analyzing large databases

• Data visualization and presentation




Requirements:

• Basic knowledge of Python (understanding of syntax, and basic OOP concepts such as classes, functions, etc.).

• Fundamental concepts of statistics (mean, median, mode, etc.).

• Basic understanding of relational databases. Fundamentals in SQL are an asset.

• Problem-solving mindset with good attention to detail, and can-do attitude.




What We Offer:

• Hands-on mentorship from experienced colleagues.

• Exposure to real-world projects and the opportunity to work on diverse challenges.

• Opportunity for career progression, including potential full-time employment upon successful completion.




Additional:

• Equipment such as a laptop will be provided




Application Process:

Please, send your CV to job@altenar.com with subject "MCAST Apprenticeship Junior Data Scientist Vacancy"

Title: Data Scientist - Ad Tech (Junior Level)
Description:
Salary: €40,000 - €55,000 (depending on experience)

Job Title: Junior Data Scientist - Ad Tech

Location: Berlin, Germany (Remote options available within Germany or Netherlands)

Industry: Ad Tech




Are you a data enthusiast looking to dive into the world of Ad Tech? We are working with a rapidly growing company in Berlin that is revolutionizing the digital advertising industry. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will join a collaborative and innovative team, working with cutting-edge technologies to analyze massive data sets, optimize ad campaigns, and drive business outcomes for clients in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Plus, this role offers remote work flexibility, allowing you to work from anywhere in Germany or the Netherlands.




About the Role

Our client specializes in developing advanced AI and machine learning solutions to optimize digital advertising across multiple platforms. They help businesses maximize their ROI by analyzing user behavior, ad performance, and audience data in real-time. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work closely with senior team members to implement machine learning models, conduct statistical analysis, and deliver insights that enhance the company’s advertising technologies.

This role offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the intersection of data science and digital advertising, with the potential for career growth in a fast-expanding company.




Key Responsibilities

Assist in the development of machine learning models to optimize ad targeting and campaign performance.
Analyze user behavior and engagement data to identify trends and insights for improving ad effectiveness.
Work with large datasets to extract meaningful insights that can drive business strategies.
Build and maintain data pipelines to support ad performance analysis and reporting.
Collaborate with marketing and product teams to design and implement data-driven solutions.
Contribute to A/B testing and experimentation to refine targeting strategies and improve ad outcomes.




What They’re Looking For

Experience: 1-2 years of experience in data science, ideally with exposure to digital advertising or marketing technologies.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python, R, and SQL; experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or similar.
Domain Knowledge: Understanding of digital advertising, ad tech, or marketing analytics is a plus.
Analytical Skills: Strong ability to analyze data, identify trends, and present findings.
Education: Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Soft Skills: Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.




Why This Opportunity?

Innovation: Work with cutting-edge technologies in the rapidly evolving ad tech space.
Learning & Growth: Work in a collaborative environment that offers mentorship and opportunities to learn from experienced data scientists.
Career Development: Access to professional development resources and the opportunity to advance within the company.
Flexible Working: Flexible work hours with options for remote work (from anywhere in Germany or the Netherlands).
Modern Workspace: Enjoy working in a modern office with state-of-the-art facilities, located in the heart of Berlin.
Great Benefits:
Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
Generous vacation days.
Health insurance and wellness programs.
Paid professional development opportunities.




About the Client

Our client is a fast-growing Ad Tech company based in Berlin, specializing in developing innovative advertising solutions that enable businesses to engage their target audiences more effectively. They work with top-tier global clients, providing data-driven insights and optimizing ad campaigns across multiple digital platforms.




How to Apply

Are you ready to take the next step in your data science career in the Ad Tech industry? Send your CV to dan.wotherspoon@intellectgroup.com or apply directly through this post.




Join a team where data science drives the future of digital advertising.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
If you are looking for an opportunity for your career, this is your time to shine! We are now looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our team.

At Marbill, we are passionate about empowering our business to succeed in the competitive world of e-commerce. Our innovative software solutions help merchants manage customers, mitigate risk, process payments, and enhance service offerings, ultimately optimizing their financial results.




Responsibilities:

Build data models, algorithms, and simulations to optimize customer experiences, revenue, and ad targeting.
Use data mining and analysis techniques to improve product development, marketing, risk assessment, and business strategies.
Collaborate with different teams to implement models and monitor results.
Create tools to track model performance and data accuracy.




Qualifications:

Graduate degree in Data Science, Maths, Statistics or related field.
Strong skills in mathematical analysis, statistics and mathematical modeling.
Strong understanding and experience with Machine Learning models and Deep Learning models.
2-4 years of proven experience with Python.
Experience in SQL and AWS.
Clear communication skills to work effectively with different teams.




Why us?

We are a functional organization where individuals work hard with flexibility and common sense

to maintain a healthy and balanced lifestyle. Our team consists of tenacious, resilient, and

accountable professionals from over 30 countries. We embrace new ideas and challenges with

a solution-oriented mindset and high energy. We equip our people with the tools they need to

deliver results and stay focused on what truly matters.

We offer:

Flexible working hours,
Hybrid or office based positions,
Competitive salary based on the interview and regular salary reviews,
All the training needed for your role,
5 days of annual leave,
Health Insurance after 3 months of employment (for permanent employees).

And if you join us in the office:

Lunch & snacks,
Parking if needed,
Sunshine almost every day.

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Graduate Data Scientist

Salary: €50.000 - €60.000

Location: Munich, Germany or Fully Remote (Must be EU based)

Company Industry: Carbon Sustainability




Intellect Group is partnering with an exciting and innovative tech start-up, financially backed by one of the world’s largest commodity trading companies, to find a Graduate Data Scientist. This is an exceptional opportunity for a graduate looking to launch their career in data science and sustainability, working with a world-class team under the guidance of industry-leading experts.




About the Company:




Our client is a dynamic start-up revolutionizing carbon solutions, offering tailored sustainability strategies designed to meet the unique goals and needs of businesses. As they build their product, the company is seeking a Graduate Data Scientist to contribute to developing cutting-edge technology at the intersection of data science and sustainability. The role offers the chance to grow in a lean, intellectually-driven team with mentorship from senior leaders.




What You'll Do:




Collaborate with a tight-knit engineering team to build data-driven carbon solutions for businesses.
Work directly with the CEO, a co-founder of Strava and Klarna, and the CTO, a data-driven technical leader, gaining invaluable insights and mentorship.
Analyze large, complex datasets to derive actionable insights and contribute to the development of sustainable product features.
Gain hands-on experience in the tech industry while contributing to the environmental impact of the company’s product offerings.
Build a strong professional foundation with an emphasis on personal growth and skill development.




What We’re Looking For:




A recent graduate with a strong background in data science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL).
A keen interest in sustainability and the potential for data science to solve complex environmental challenges.
Analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret and manipulate large datasets.
Excellent teamwork and communication skills in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




Why This Opportunity?




Join a rapidly growing start-up with financial backing from a global leader in commodity trading.
Work directly with a CEO with a proven track record in tech (Strava, Klarna) and a CTO who is deeply involved in data-driven decision-making.
Be part of a mission-driven company focused on sustainability, while developing your career in data science.
Receive hands-on mentorship in a small, agile team where your contributions are valued and impactful.
Competitive salary and benefits package.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At Freeday, we aim to unlock human potential by leveraging disruptive technologies and building an AI-powered digital workforce that excels in repetitive tasks. By automating these tasks, we allow people to focus on more creative, rewarding work. We are a young, fast-growing IT company with a dynamic, no-nonsense culture. Located in the heart of Rotterdam, our team is driven by innovation, collaboration, and a passion for AI's potential to change the world.

Freeday is looking for a motivated Machine Learning Engineer to join our fast-growing AI team. This is an exciting opportunity to take your career to the next level by working on innovative machine-learning solutions that power our automated services. You will be involved in the development, deployment, and optimization of machine learning models, all within a supportive environment that encourages growth and learning.




As a Machine Learning Engineer at Freeday, you'll be surrounded by forward-thinking, innovative minds and cutting-edge AI technologies. Whether you’ve had 1 or 3 years of experience, we want someone who’s eager to learn, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and contribute to the projects that will shape the future of automation.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement machine learning models to drive our automated services.
Collaborate closely with product and engineering teams to define project objectives and align machine learning efforts with business goals.
Optimize machine learning algorithms for scalability and performance.
Contribute to the deployment of machine learning models in production environments using MLOps practices.
Continuously learn and adapt to new machine learning techniques and tools.
Take ownership of your projects while working in close collaboration with more senior team members for guidance and support.




What We Offer:

A dynamic, fast-growing, and innovative work environment.
A competitive salary and pension plan.
Opportunities for professional development, including learning new machine learning techniques and tools.
A fun, inclusive, and collaborative team culture with regular social events, sports activities, and team-building opportunities.
The chance to work on impactful projects that automate workflows and unlock human potential.
A company laptop to support your work effectively.
Room for growth, initiative, and the chance to make a real difference within the team




Our Culture:




At Freeday, we’re not just about the work—we’re about you. We embrace a collaborative and innovative culture where ideas flow freely, and everyone is encouraged to take ownership. Whether you’re developing machine learning models or learning new skills, you’ll be part of a supportive environment where growth and personal development are key.




Requirements:

1-3 years of experience in machine learning or a related role, preferably in the tech sector.
Strong programming skills in Python and a good understanding of popular ML frameworks (such as TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Basic familiarity with cloud technologies like AWS or Google Cloud.
Some experience or familiarity with MLOps tools like MLflow or Kubeflow is a plus.
You enjoy tackling challenges, are not afraid to take initiative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about automation, AI, and the potential of technology to solve real-world problems.
Great communication skills and a team-oriented mindset.




***

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
The Machine Learning Engineer will focus on designing, developing, and optimizing advanced TTS, voice cloning models, and voice-enabled Large Language Models (Voice LLMs) that combine the naturalness of TTS with the intelligence of LLMs. By leveraging state-of-the-art technologies such as scalable zero-shot synthesis, this role is integral to creating systems that redefine how machines generate and mimic human speech. You will play a pivotal role in pioneering innovations in speech synthesis and shaping the future of human-AI interaction.

Research and Development:


Research and develop state-of-the-art Text-to-Speech (TTS) models and voice-enabled Large Language Models (LLMs), focusing on naturalness, scalability, and zero-shot capabilities
Implement voice cloning technologies to replicate specific voice characteristics while ensuring scalability and efficiency
Design, develop, and optimize algorithms for neural vocoders, speaker adaptation, and scalable zero-shot TTS synthesizers
Extend existing TTS architectures and contribute to developing/training new models for multiple languages, ensuring high-quality synthesis and speaker consistency
Build and maintain data pipelines to preprocess, augment, and manage audio datasets for model training
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate TTS models into Conversational AI platforms
Conduct performance tuning to minimize latency and enhance the scalability of TTS systems in production environments
Stay up-to-date with advancements in LLM-based TTS, generative models, and speech signal processing to drive innovation in solutions



Ownership:


Take full ownership of tasks and projects, from conceptualization to deployment, highlighting testing to ensure accountability and high-quality results
Integrate software components into a fully functional software system



Agile Methodologies & Collaboration


Actively participate in Agile software development processes, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives to ensure timely and high-quality deliverables
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and other engineers, to gather requirements and ensure alignment on project goals
Participate in project planning, including research and development
Contribute to the backlog of tasks with improvements and suggestions
Implement Proof of Concepts (PoC) to introduce new solutions and ideas to the team
Effectively manage time and meet deadlines



Contribute actively and effectively as an integrated team member


Meet regularly with the line manager to review progress
Manage issue resolution and critically escalate
Work effectively with other teams, units, and departments
Manage issues with clarity and ensure effective information flow and team working
Support organization's other priority activities, when necessary
Act as an Omilia ambassador



Requirements


MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related subject
2+ years of experience in speech synthesis development roles
Ph.D. in a relevant field is a plus but not required
Proven experience in developing AI-driven applications, particularly in speech synthesis, voice cloning, or related fields
Strong understanding of state-of-the-art voice LLM techniques
Proficiency in Python and deep learning frameworks like PyTorch or TensorFlow
Hands-on experience with TTS frameworks (e.g., Tacotron, FastSpeech, FastPitch, VITS) and neural vocoders (e.g., HiFi-GAN, WaveGlow, Vocos)
Hands-on experience with LLMs, Generative Models, Transformers and diffusion models
Familiarity with zero-shot synthesis approaches and multi-speaker TTS systems
Self-motivated and driven to create extraordinary things
Ability to work under pressure and on strict deadlines
Continuous innovation mindset
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English
Effective time management skills and the ability to meet deadlines



Nice to have


Experience with AWS cloud platform for scalable model deployment and monitoring
Experience with NVIDIA Triton Inference Server
Experience with MLOps practices



Benefits


Fixed compensation;
Long-term employment with the working days vacation;
Development in professional growth (courses, training, etc);
Being part of successful cutting-edge technology products that are making a global impact in the service industry;
Proficient and fun-to-work-with colleagues;
Apple gear


Omilia is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We believe that embracing diversity in all its forms enriches our workplace and drives our collective success. We are committed to creating an environment where everyone feels welcomed, valued, and empowered to contribute their unique perspectives without regard to factors such as race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, heredity, disability, age, or veteran status, all eligible candidates will be given consideration for employment.

Title: Data Scientist (F/H)
Description:
About The Job

La Maison

Depuis 1854, les femmes et les hommes de Louis Vuitton partagent le même esprit d'excellence et réinventent chaque jour leur métier.

Chaque parcours est un véritable voyage, nourri d'émotion et de conquête, d'envie et d'audace. Aujourd'hui, dans un contexte de forte croissance, Louis Vuitton vous invite à imaginer votre propre voyage en rejoignant nos équipes.

Louis Vuitton respecte et promeut l’égalité des chances. Nous célébrons et accueillons toutes les singularités et nous engageons à créer un environnement de travail inclusif.

L’équipe

Au sein de la Direction Digital Retail et Client Development, vous serez rattaché(e) au pôle Data Science & IA. Vous transformez les métiers en étant au cœur de l’activité et en collaborant au quotidien avec les équipes.

Job responsibilities

Vos Missions

Cadrage et pilotage :


Après avoir recueilli les besoins des équipes business, vous définissez et pilotez les projets Data & IA pour résoudre leurs problématiques. Vous évaluez les priorités, suivez les avancements et communiquez en permanence avec l’ensemble des acteurs.
Vous construisez des argumentaires solides pour faire valoir vos choix et faites le pont entre les équipes techniques et les équipes métiers, trouvez les leviers de compromis pour faire aboutir les sujets.


Mise en œuvre et exploitation :


Vous mettez en œuvre les projets et analyses data science, en réponse aux problématiques digitales et retail, en utilisant les techniques les plus adaptées et les plus performantes.
Vous mesurez la performance et l’apport des modèles de machine learning, en comparant aux approches métiers utilisées. Vous mesurez les bénéfices/ROI après leur mise en œuvre.
Vous mettez en production les différentes méthodes implémentés en collaboration avec les data engineers.


Adoption et engagement :


Vous restituez les résultats tout en alertant si nécessaire.
Vous accompagnez les équipes business dans l’exploitation des outils mis en place et formez les équipes aux principes et techniques data et IA.
Vous améliorez les modèles et les outils en continu, en fonction des retours des équipes.


Profile

A propos de vous


Vous êtes diplômé(e) d'un Bac+5 en Ecole d'Ingénieur ou Université et justifiez d'au-moins 3 ans d'expérience en data science, idéalement sur des problématiques orientées clients et retail ;
Vous maîtrisez les principales techniques statistiques, les modèles descriptifs et prédictifs, et algorithmes de machine learning ;
Vous êtes reconnu(e) pour votre expertise dans l'analyse des bases de données volumineuses, complexes, dans des environnements distribués ;
Vous disposez d'une expérience significative de développement data science sur Google Cloud Platform (GCP) et sur des outils de data visualisation (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik...) ;
Vous maîtrisez le logiciel de Data Science Dataiku et avez une très bonne connaissance du langage Python ;
Vous avez un niveau d'anglais courant, à l'écrit comme à l'oral ;
Vous êtes reconnu(e) pour votre excellent relationnel et votre esprit d’équipe ;
Vous êtes sensible à l’univers du luxe, et répondez aux compétences que ce milieu implique : excellence, rigueur, sens du détail, créativité.


Pourquoi participer à l’aventure ?


Pour travailler dans une entreprise en forte croissance et devenir vous aussi un(e) acteur/actrice de cette réussite ;
Pour travailler en plein cœur de Paris, dans le 1er arrondissement ;
Pour grandir et bénéficier d’un suivi RH personnalisé tout au long de votre carrière.


Vous êtes partant(e) ? Nous vous attendons !

Reference LVM26446
